original: da ni gzhung gi tshad ma nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas zhes smos te /
analyzed: da ni gzhung gi tshad ma nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas zhes smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the measure of the treatise, it is said, following the explanatory tantra.üîΩFollowing the tantras such as the Vajra Garland.

original: rdo rje phreng ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs bas so //
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba la sogs pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs bas so //
translated: It is said:

original: smras bshad shin tu rnyed bar dka' //
analyzed: smras bshad shin tu rnyed bar dka' //
translated: The explanation is very difficult to find.

original: zhes pa ni smras pa de nyid bshad pa ni bstan bcos kyi don ma lus pa yongs su ma brtags na rnyed par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni smras pa de nyid bshad pa ni bstan bcos kyi don ma lus pa yongs su ma brtags na rnyed par dka' ba'o //
translated: This is the explanation of just that statement: the entire meaning of the treatise is difficult to find without thorough analysis.

original: des ni sgra ji bzhin pa la brten te bshad pa po gzhan rnams la sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: des ni sgra ji bzhin pa la brten te bshad pa po gzhan rnams la sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: This is the refutation of other commentators who rely on the literal meaning.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / rnal 'byor rgyud rnams 'di nyid kyis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rnal 'byor rgyud rnams 'di nyid kyis //
translated: the Yoga Tantras are drawn out by this,

original: drangs te bshad pa gzhan gyis min //
analyzed: drangs te bshad pa gzhan gyis min //
translated: not by another explanation.

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud chen po ni bshad pa 'di nyid kyis bshad par rigs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud chen po ni bshad pa 'di nyid kyis bshad par rigs so //
translated: The great Yoga Tantra is to be explained by this very explanation.

original: gzhan du min sgra ji bzhin pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du min sgra ji bzhin pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Not by another, not by the mere literal meaning.

original: nye bar sdud pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar sdud pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize,

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: he says ‚Äútherefore‚Äù and so forth.

original: rdo rje slob dpon ni yang dag pa'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa las so //
analyzed: rdo rje slob dpon ni yang dag pa'i dbang bskur ba la sogs pa yon tan gyi tshogs dang ldan pa las so //
translated: The Vajra Master is endowed with the collection of good qualities such as the perfect empowerment.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud la mkhas pa las ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud la mkhas pa las ni rdo rje slob dpon gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The difference of the Vajra Master is from the one skilled in the explanatory Tantra.

original: gleng gzhi ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: The nidana is the creation stage.

original: rim pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: rim pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: The stage is the stage of completion.

original: de dag gi sbyor ba ni @95a * //
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba ni @95a * //
translated: Their yoga is

original: bshad pa'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: the connection of the explanation.

original: yis ni byed pa'i gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yis ni byed pa'i gsum pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúby‚Äù is the third case, the instrumental.

original: de'i sgo nas bshad pa'i rgyud la mkhas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gang yin pa de las so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas bshad pa'i rgyud la mkhas pa'i rdo rje slob dpon gang yin pa de las so //
translated: From that, from the Vajra Master who is skilled in the explanation of the tantra,

original: 'bad de ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rtsol bas so //
analyzed: 'bad de ni thos pa la sogs pa'i rtsol bas so //
translated: ‚Äúwith effort‚Äù means with the exertion of listening and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor rgyud rnams gzung zhes pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud rnams mnyan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud rnams gzung zhes pa'i rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud rnams mnyan par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should hold the Yoga Tantras‚Äù means one should listen to the Yoga Tantra.

original: de lta na rim pa'i sgras ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa gnyis ka brjod na /
analyzed: de lta na rim pa'i sgras ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa gnyis ka brjod na /
translated: In that case, if the word ‚Äústage‚Äù refers to both the creation and completion,

original: 'dir rdzogs pa gcig pu ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: 'dir rdzogs pa gcig pu ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: how is it that here only the completion is referred to?

original: smras pa gleng gzhi'i sgra gang du yod pas de'i phyir gleng gzhi'i sgras ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod do zhes don gyi shugs kyis rim pa'i sgras rdzogs pa'i rim brjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa gleng gzhi'i sgra gang du yod pas de'i phyir gleng gzhi'i sgras ni bskyed pa'i rim pa brjod do zhes don gyi shugs kyis rim pa'i sgras rdzogs pa'i rim brjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that the word ‚Äústage‚Äù refers to the creation stage, because the word ‚Äústage‚Äù in the context of the nidana refers to the creation stage.

original: gang gi phyir spyi'i sgra rnams ni rgyud rnam pa bzhis khyad par can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi'i sgra rnams ni rgyud rnam pa bzhis khyad par can du 'gyur te /
translated: Because general terms are qualified by four types of context:

original: don dang rtags dang rab tu byed pa dang sgra gzhan dang 'grogs pas so //
analyzed: don dang rtags dang rab tu byed pa dang sgra gzhan dang 'grogs pas so //
translated: meaning, indication, application, and other terms.

original: de la don gyis ni dper na bza' ba po 'di yin no zhes 'dis thams cad bza' ba po yin pas bza' ba po'i sgras don gyi shugs las khyad par ston te /
analyzed: de la don gyis ni dper na bza' ba po 'di yin no zhes 'dis thams cad bza' ba po yin pas bza' ba po'i sgras don gyi shugs las khyad par ston te /
translated: In terms of meaning, for example, the term eater is applied to all who eat, and the term eater indicates the meaning of eater by implication.

original: des na mang po za zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: des na mang po za zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that many eat.

original: rab tu byed pas ni dper na sen da ba khyer la shog ces pas tshang ba ngan  gnas pa'i mis tshva 'ong ngo //
analyzed: rab tu byed pas ni dper na sen da ba khyer la shog ces pas tshang ba ngan  gnas pa'i mis tshva 'ong ngo //
translated: In terms of application, for example, the phrase ‚ÄúBring the Senava‚Äù is applied by a person who lives in a salty place to mean ‚ÄúBring salt.‚Äù

original: g-yul ngor gnas pa'i mis smras na rta 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yul ngor gnas pa'i mis smras na rta 'dod pa yin no //
translated: If it is spoken by a person who lives in a battlefield, it means ‚ÄúBring a horse.‚Äù

original: rtags kyis ni go zhes 'dis rtags gnyis ka can yin yang bud med kyi rtags kyi rkyen dang gzhi mthun pas bud med kyi don la 'jug go //
analyzed: rtags kyis ni go zhes 'dis rtags gnyis ka can yin yang bud med kyi rtags kyi rkyen dang gzhi mthun pas bud med kyi don la 'jug go //
translated: In terms of indication, for example, the term go indicates both a cow and a bull, but because the condition of the sign of a cow is common, it is applied to the meaning of a cow.

original: dper na go ai yam zhes pas mo bstan to //
analyzed: dper na go ai yam zhes pas mo bstan to //
translated: For example, the term go indicates a cow.

original: go aa yi zhes pas pho bstan to //
analyzed: go aa yi zhes pas pho bstan to //
translated: The word go indicates the male.

original: sgra gzhan dang 'grogs pa ni pa yang 'ongs pa dang glang rnams kyang 'ongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra gzhan dang 'grogs pa ni pa yang 'ongs pa dang glang rnams kyang 'ongs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: When it is combined with other words, it is like the cows have come and so forth.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in the same way here as well.

original: rgyan rnam pa bdun bshad pa'i rigs pa'o zhes pa 'dis rgyan gyi bshad pa rdzogs zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan rnam pa bdun bshad pa'i rigs pa'o zhes pa 'dis rgyan gyi bshad pa rdzogs zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: This is explained by the seven ornaments are explained, the reasoning is complete, which indicates the completion of the explanation of the ornaments.

original: da ni le'u bcu bdun gyis bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: da ni le'u bcu bdun gyis bsdus pa'i don bshad par bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the meaning contained in the seventeen chapters should be explained.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni rgyud kyi don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni rgyud kyi don ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The intention there is that the meaning of the tantra is threefold:

original: tshig gi don dang / ngag gi don dang / bsdus pa'i don no //
analyzed: tshig gi don dang / ngag gi don dang / bsdus pa'i don no //
translated: the meaning of the words, the meaning of the speech, and the summarized meaning.

original: de la tshig gi don ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshig gi don ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Among them, the meaning of the words is the explanation beginning with Thus have I heard.

original: ngag gi don ni le'u so so dag tu yod pa'i ngag rnams kyis brjod par bya @95b ba so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi don ni le'u so so dag tu yod pa'i ngag rnams kyis brjod par bya @95b ba so sor bstan pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the speech is what is to be expressed, indicated by the individual speeches in the individual chapters.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni le'u de rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ni 'di yin te zhes brtag pa na bsdus te don so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni le'u de rnams kyis brjod par bya ba ni 'di yin te zhes brtag pa na bsdus te don so sor bstan pa'o //
translated: When examined, the summarized meaning is taught individually.üîΩAmong those, the summarized meaning is ascertained. The meaning of the words and the meaning of the statements are easily understood.

original: de la bsdus pa'i don nges pa las tshig gi don dang ngag gi don dag ni bde bar rtogs pas dang po bsdus pa'i don smra bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa'i don nges pa las tshig gi don dang ngag gi don dag ni bde bar rtogs pas dang po bsdus pa'i don smra bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to state the summarized meaning at the beginning,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that, there is the meaning of the words and the meaning of the statements.‚Äù

original: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rjod pa dang brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i zhes pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthe nature of Vajradhara, who is the nature of the expression and the expressed‚Äù is as follows:

original: rjod pa ni rgyud kyi tshig rnams so //
analyzed: rjod pa ni rgyud kyi tshig rnams so //
translated: The expression is the words of the tantra.

original: brjod par bya ba ni rim pa gnyis so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni rim pa gnyis so //
translated: The expressed is the two stages.

original: de dag gi bdag nyid ni ngo bo gang la yod brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi bdag nyid ni ngo bo gang la yod brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po ste /
translated: The nature of those is the essence of the expression and the expressed, the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bstan to //
translated: He is taught to be glorious Vajrasattva.

original: gang gi phyir rgyud kyi tshig rnams dang de las nye bar dmigs pa'i don gyi khyad par bsgoms pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyud kyi tshig rnams dang de las nye bar dmigs pa'i don gyi khyad par bsgoms pa rnams kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because by the words of the tantra and by the special objects that are visualized in them, one attains the very body of Great Vajradhara.

original: sgra dang don gyi ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa' kho na'o //
analyzed: sgra dang don gyi ngo bo rdo rje sems dpa' kho na'o //
translated: The nature of the sound and the meaning is Vajrasattva himself.

original: gang gi phyir lte ba na gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo 'od gsal ba las /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lte ba na gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi 'khor lo 'od gsal ba las /
translated: Because from the clear light of the wheel of the ultimate realm that abides at the navel,

original: srog gi rlung langs te gnas brgyad dang phrad pas yi ge rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te de dag gi tshig rnams so //
analyzed: srog gi rlung langs te gnas brgyad dang phrad pas yi ge rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te de dag gi tshig rnams so //
translated: the life-force wind arises and by encountering the eight places, the syllables arise, which are the words.

original: de dag gis kyang ngag bskyed cing de las kyang rgyud dang rab tu byed pa la sogs pa sgra'i tshogs thams cad rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin no /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang ngag bskyed cing de las kyang rgyud dang rab tu byed pa la sogs pa sgra'i tshogs thams cad rgyu dang rjes su mthun pa nyid yin no /
translated: And by them, speech is generated and from that, all the collections of sounds such as tantras and chapters are in accord with the cause.

original: rgyu de yang 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu de yang 'od gsal ba'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid do //
translated: And that cause is the clear light itself, Great Vajradhara.

original: yang na brjod pa ni rgyud kyi ming ste gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na brjod pa ni rgyud kyi ming ste gsang ba 'dus pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the expression is the name of the tantra, which is called the Guhyasamaja.

original: des ni sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid de rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo nyid sangs rgyas thams cad 'dus pa'i bdag nyid de rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That shows the nature of the body, speech, and mind, the identity of the embodiment of all buddhas, Vajrasattva.

original: brjod par bya ba ni rim pa gnyis te /üîΩde las bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni rim pa gnyis te / de las bskyed pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi ngo bo rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The subject matter is twofold:

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa yang rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the creation stage, which is the identity of the three meditative stabilizations beginning with the first yoga, and the perfection stage, which is the character of the stages beginning with vajra repetition.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo zung du 'jug pa lnga pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba de yang rdo rje 'chang nyid do //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo zung du 'jug pa lnga pa'i ting nge 'dzin las rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ba de yang rdo rje 'chang nyid do //
translated: There, the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara through the meditative stabilization of union, the identity of cause and effect, is also Vajradhara.

original: bcom ldan 'das des le'u dang po las lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis bstan to zhes 'brel @96a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des le'u dang po las lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis bstan to zhes 'brel @96a * //
translated: That BhagavƒÅn taught the two kinds of deity yoga in the first chapter.

original: ba'o ; / sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhes pa ni reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung bar ro //
analyzed: ba'o ; / sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor du zhes pa ni reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung bar ro //
translated: In the emanation mandala means in the dharma-sphere of SparshavajrƒÅ.

original: nyan pa'i bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyung ba'i sngags kyis dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spros te /
analyzed: nyan pa'i bskal pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i phyung ba'i sngags kyis dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor spros te /
translated: The eon of listening, etc. means that the pledge mandala is emanated by the mantra that was uttered, ‚Äúvajra-dh·πõk,‚Äù etc.

original: de nyid la rig ma'i dbang bskur ba byin nas zhes pa ni rig ma'i chos 'byung bar dbang bskur ba ni rig ma'i dbang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid la rig ma'i dbang bskur ba byin nas zhes pa ni rig ma'i chos 'byung bar dbang bskur ba ni rig ma'i dbang ngo //
translated: Having bestowed the consecration of the knowledge[-goddesses] in just that [mandala] means that the consecration in the dharma-sphere of the knowledge[-goddesses] is the consecration of the knowledge[-goddesses].

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúwith the bodhicitta‚Äù is that.

original: byin nas ni byin gyis brlab par byas nas so //
analyzed: byin nas ni byin gyis brlab par byas nas so //
translated: Having bestowed means having consecrated.

original: drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The interpretable meaning and the definitive meaning, etc.

original: de la brtags pa'i rim pa ni drang ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de la brtags pa'i rim pa ni drang ba'i don gyis so //
translated: Therein, the sequence of investigation is by the interpretable meaning.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni nges pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni nges pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The sequence of completion is by the definitive meaning.

original: le'u bcu drug pa las don gzhan dag rnyed pas zhes pa ni de la yang don de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: le'u bcu drug pa las don gzhan dag rnyed pas zhes pa ni de la yang don de nyid bstan to //
translated: Since other topics are found in the sixteenth chapter, that topic is also taught there.

original: de lta na bcu drug pa dang le'u dang po dag gi bye brag gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na bcu drug pa dang le'u dang po dag gi bye brag gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between the sixteenth chapter and the first chapter?

original: don gzhan dag rnyed nas zhes smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan dag rnyed nas zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that having found other meanings,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i don blangs pa yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i don blangs pa yin gyi de nyid ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: the meaning that is similar to that is taken up, but it is not that itself.

original: lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag de nyid rtogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim par byed pa'i thabs so sor bstan zhing gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa dag de nyid rtogs pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim par byed pa'i thabs so sor bstan zhing gsungs pa'o //
translated: The two kinds of divine yoga are the generation stage and the completion stage.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni rgyal bu don thams cad grub pas byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs las 'das te rdo rje 'chang ba'i sku thob nas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni rgyal bu don thams cad grub pas byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs las 'das te rdo rje 'chang ba'i sku thob nas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The intention of that is that Prince SarvƒÅrthasiddha, having transcended the bodhisattva stage and attained the body of Vajradhara, in order to care for the realm of sentient beings in the future,

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin pa snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin pa snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: entered into the meditative absorption called the method of great passion.

original: spyan la sogs pa rigs kyi lha mo bzhi dang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i yul gyi lha mo lnga spros te /
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa rigs kyi lha mo bzhi dang gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i yul gyi lha mo lnga spros te /
translated: The four goddesses of the families, LocanƒÅ and so forth, and the five goddesses of the objects, R≈´pavajrƒÅ and so forth, emanate.

original: de dang lhan cig tu bde ba chen po dam pa rjes su myong nas de dag kho na rang gi sku la 'jug par mdzad cing slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i gzugs su phyir spros te /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu bde ba chen po dam pa rjes su myong nas de dag kho na rang gi sku la 'jug par mdzad cing slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i gzugs su phyir spros te /
translated: Having experienced the supreme great bliss together with them, they enter into his body. Again, they emanate in the forms of the five tathƒÅgatas.

original: rin po che sna bdun gzhal yas khang pa'i nang du bzhugs pa de la de rnams kyis gsol ba gdab pa gsan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkon pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir cang mi gsung bar gyur pas slar yang zhus par gyur
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gzhal yas khang pa'i nang du bzhugs pa de la de rnams kyis gsol ba gdab pa gsan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsang ba 'dus pa'i dkon pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir cang mi gsung bar gyur pas slar yang zhus par gyur
translated: They request the BhagavƒÅn to teach the rarity of the GuhyasamƒÅja, and the BhagavƒÅn, having listened to their request, remains silent in order to teach the rarity of the GuhyasamƒÅja.

analyzed: te / de nas de dang nang du 'jug cing badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod @96b pa reg bya rdo rje ma'i chos 'byung ba'i nang du padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du spros nas de rnams la byang chub kyi sems kyis dbang
translated: Then, entering into that, one should emanate Ak·π£obhya with ‚Äúvajra-dh·πõk‚Äù and so on, and so forth, on a lotus and moon ma·πá·∏çala in the dharmacakra of Spar≈õavajrƒÅ, and confer the empowerment of bodhicitta upon them.

original: bskur te de las kyang phyir spros te /

analyzed: dbus kyi gtso bo'i bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i gzugs su bzhugs par gyur to //

analyzed: le'u bcu drug pa las gsang ba lnga'i lha'i 'khor lo'i rim pa gnyis kyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir ngag gi don ni 'di yin te /

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos dang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin bstan nas thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku la dmigs te /

analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rnal 'byor gyi rgyud chen po'i rim pa gnyis rjod par byed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang po'i le'u gsungs te /

analyzed: lha'i rnal 'byor gnyis kyis rgod pa skyes par gyur na de nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'ba' zhig gtsor gyur pa byang chub kyi sems kyi le'u gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: If agitation arises due to the two yogas of the deity, in order to pacify that, the second chapter on bodhicitta is taught, which is mainly focused on the completion stage alone.

analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa las dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa las sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag go //

analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa 'ba' zhig la zhugs pas gzhan gyi don mi 'grub pas de bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Since one who is engaged only in the ultimate truth does not accomplish the welfare of others, in order to accomplish that,

analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor rjod par byed pa ni le'u gsum pa bstan to //

original: yongs su dag pa'i sgra ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i sgra'i yang don gnyis pa nye bar blangs pa'i phyir phra mo'i rnal 'byor yang rnam pa gsum du bshad do //

original: de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa las rdo rje bzlas pa la 'dus so //üîΩsku rdzogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs @97a * //
analyzed: de yang rdzogs pa'i rim pa las rdo rje bzlas pa la 'dus so // sku rdzogs pa ni de bzhin gshegs @97a * //

analyzed: pa'i dbang bskur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir le'u bzhi pa gsungs te /

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa dang slob ma rnams la dbang bskur ba'i ched du thugs kyi dkyil 'khor so sor bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //

analyzed: dbang bskur ba thob pas rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa gsum gyis dngos grub thob pa yang yin zhes de'i phyir le'u lnga pa bstan to //

analyzed: dad pa'i sbyor ba'i yan lag bzhi pa rnal 'byor chen po zhes bya ba yin no //

original: de yang nye bar mtshon pa yin te /

original: le'u bdun pa la ni khyad par gang yang med do //
analyzed: le'u bdun pa la ni khyad par gang yang med do //

original: 'on kyang le'u lnga pa las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa'i spros pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: 'on kyang le'u lnga pa las bshad pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa'i spros pa nyid bstan te /
translated: However, the elaboration of the yoga practice explained in the fifth chapter is taught,

original: las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //
translated: which is a branch of the samƒÅdhi of Karma-Udbhava.

original: gtsod pa dang mi gtsod pa'i rnam par rtog pa zlog pa med pas spyod pa'am sngags kyi sku mi 'grub pas de'i phyir gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba so sor bstan par byed pa le'u brgyad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gtsod pa dang mi gtsod pa'i rnam par rtog pa zlog pa med pas spyod pa'am sngags kyi sku mi 'grub pas de'i phyir gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba so sor bstan par byed pa le'u brgyad pa gsungs so //
translated: Since there is no reversal of the conception of purity and impurity, the body of conduct or mantra is not accomplished. Therefore, the eighth chapter is taught to individually explain the secret empowerment.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi yan lag go //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi yan lag go //
translated: It is a branch of the Ma·πá·∏çala-Udbhava and Karma-Udbhava.

original: nan gyis sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can gyi don 'grub ces shin tu rmad du 'byung ba'i lung bstan rjod par byed pa le'u dgu pa bstan te /
analyzed: nan gyis sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sems can gyi don 'grub ces shin tu rmad du 'byung ba'i lung bstan rjod par byed pa le'u dgu pa bstan te /
translated: Chapter Nine is taught, which is the most marvelous prophecy, ‚ÄúThe attainment of the benefit of sentient beings is by the samƒÅdhi of intense union.‚Äù

original: las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi yan lag go //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi yan lag go //
translated: [This is] the branch of the supreme victorious action.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi snying pos bskul bas sems can gyi don dang dngos grub mngon du 'gyur bas de'i ched du bsdums dang / sbyin pa dang / dbyes dang / 'chad pa zhes bya ba thabs bzhi gtsor gyur pa le'u bcu pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs kyi snying pos bskul bas sems can gyi don dang dngos grub mngon du 'gyur bas de'i ched du bsdums dang / sbyin pa dang / dbyes dang / 'chad pa zhes bya ba thabs bzhi gtsor gyur pa le'u bcu pa gsungs so //
translated: Chapter Ten is taught, which is the four methods that are foremost: the pacification, generosity, expansion, and explanation, for the sake of the attainment of the benefit of sentient beings and the direct realization of power by the urging of the essence of the mind of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi shin tu rnal 'byor ces bya ba la yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi shin tu rnal 'byor ces bya ba la yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúextremely yoga‚Äù of the samƒÅdhi of the initial union is the third branch.

original: las kyi rgyal ba mchog ces la la 'dod do //üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis rlob pa thob pas sngags kyi sku rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: las kyi rgyal ba mchog ces la la 'dod do // de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis rlob pa thob pas sngags kyi sku rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Some assert that it is the ‚Äúsupreme victorious action.‚ÄùüîΩThe two kinds of mantra body are attained by the blessing of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: @97b sngags dang ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: @97b sngags dang ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: They are the mantra body and the gnosis body.

original: de dag gi slad du le'u bcu gcig pa bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi slad du le'u bcu gcig pa bstan to //
translated: For their sake, the eleventh chapter is taught.

original: sngags kyi sku ni dbang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku ni dbang po'i sbyor ba dang dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //
translated: The mantra body is the limb of the samƒÅdhi of the supreme victor of the ma·πá·∏çala, which is the application of the sense organs.

original: ye shes kyi sku ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku ni bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i yan lag ces bya'o //
translated: The gnosis body is called the limb of the consecration of oneself.

original: spros pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir sku rnam pa gnyis po yang phyag rgya chen por yongs su 'gyur bar bya ba'i ched du le'u bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: spros pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir sku rnam pa gnyis po yang phyag rgya chen por yongs su 'gyur bar bya ba'i ched du le'u bcu gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: In order to abandon conceptual elaborations, the two bodies are transformed into the great seal. For that purpose, the twelfth chapter is taught.

original: snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gam /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gam /
translated: As before, the supreme victor of the ma·πá·∏çala

original: las kyi rgyal ba mchog gam bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyal ba mchog gam bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: or the supreme victor of activity is taught as the limb of the stage of the consecration of oneself.

original: rim pa gnyis pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs rab 'byams rjod par byed pa le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas 'gro ba'i don bya ba'i phyir zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs rab 'byams rjod par byed pa le'u bcu gsum pa dang bcu bzhi pa dag bstan to //
translated: In order for the yogi/nƒ´ who has completed the two stages to perform the benefit of migrating beings, the thirteenth and fourteenth chapters are taught, which express the vast collection of pacifying and so on.

original: rim pa gnyis kyi yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis kyi yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as a branch of the two stages.

original: de dag thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'grub par 'gyur zhes de'i slad du le'u bco lnga pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad nye bar mi dmigs pas sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'grub par 'gyur zhes de'i slad du le'u bco lnga pa gsungs so //
translated: Since all of those are not perceived, it is accomplished by the illusion-like samadhi.  Therefore, the fifteenth chapter is taught.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i nang nas bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i nang nas bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa'i yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as a branch of the stage of self-consecration within the completion stage.

original: le'u bcu drug pa ni le'u bzhi pa'i yan lag yin te /
analyzed: le'u bcu drug pa ni le'u bzhi pa'i yan lag yin te /
translated: The sixteenth chapter is a branch of the fourth chapter.

original: gang gi phyir bzhi pa las thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gcig pu gsungs pas sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyis yongs su bkang bar bya ba'i phyir le'u bcu drug pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzhi pa las thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gcig pu gsungs pas sku gsung thugs kyi dkyil 'khor gyis yongs su bkang bar bya ba'i phyir le'u bcu drug pa yin te /
translated: Because only the mind mandala is taught in the fourth chapter, the sixteenth chapter is for the purpose of filling with the body, speech, and mind mandalas.

original: yi ge gsum gyi rgyud ni sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyi rgyud ni sku gsung thugs kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three-syllable tantra is the essence of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar le'u bcu drug gis bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar le'u bcu drug gis bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the perfection of one's own and others' goals should be understood through the sixteen chapters.

original: de yang dam tshig dang sdom pa ma gtogs par 'grub par mi 'gyur bas thabs phun sum tshogs pa gtsor gyur pa le'u bcu bdun pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang dam tshig dang sdom pa ma gtogs par 'grub par mi 'gyur bas thabs phun sum tshogs pa gtsor gyur pa le'u bcu bdun pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, since one will not succeed without the commitments and vows, the excellent means is taught in the seventeenth chapter.

original: dang po'i sbyor ba'i yan lag ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba dang po ste /
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba'i yan lag ni rnal 'byor zhes bya ba dang po ste /
translated: The limb of the first application is the first yoga.

original: dam tshig dang sdom pa blangs nas rim pa gnyis sgom pa la dbang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dam tshig dang sdom pa blangs nas rim pa gnyis sgom pa la dbang ba'i phyir //
translated: Having taken the commitments and vows, one is empowered to cultivate the two stages.

original: de las le'u gzhan med do //
analyzed: de las le'u gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other chapter than that.

original: de ltar na le'u bco brgyad pa yang yod pas ci'i phyir bcu bdun po kho nar bstan to zhe na //
analyzed: de ltar na le'u bco brgyad pa yang yod pas ci'i phyir bcu bdun po kho nar bstan to zhe na //
translated: Thus, since there is also an eighteenth chapter, why are only seventeen taught?

original: bden te 'on kyang bco brgyad pa ni le'u bcu bdun po rnams kyi bshad pa dang 'dra @98a * //
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang bco brgyad pa ni le'u bcu bdun po rnams kyi bshad pa dang 'dra @98a * //
translated: It is true, but the eighteenth is similar to the explanation of the seventeen chapters.

original: ba yin pas de'i bsdus pa'i don tha dad par ma bstan te /
analyzed: ba yin pas de'i bsdus pa'i don tha dad par ma bstan te /
translated: Therefore, its summarized meaning is not taught separately,

original: rgyud phyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud phyi ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a sequel to the tantra.

original: de bas na de ni 'dus pa'i phyi ma zhes grags pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na de ni 'dus pa'i phyi ma zhes grags pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, since it is renowned as the sequel to the Guhyasamaja, there is no contradiction.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud ma lus pa'i sgra dang don gyi rgyan gyi dbye bas gang don rnam pa bcu bshad pa de rnams tshig re re la ji ltar gnas zhes so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyud ma lus pa'i sgra dang don gyi rgyan gyi dbye bas gang don rnam pa bcu bshad pa de rnams tshig re re la ji ltar gnas zhes so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúnow‚Äù and so on, in order to explain how the ten topics are situated in each word, he teaches the ten topics that were explained by the divisions of the ornament of words and meanings of the entire tantra.

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúnow‚Äù and so on,

original: 'di skad bdag gis zhes /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis zhes /
translated: ‚ÄúThus have I heard‚Äù

original: bya ba nas bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bshad pa'i tshul rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la yi ge'i don la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba nas bzhugs so zhes bya ba'i bar du ni bshad pa'i tshul rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba la yi ge'i don la sogs pa ste /
translated: up to ‚Äúdwelt‚Äù are the four modes of explanation, that is, the meaning of the syllables and so on.

original: rim pa gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pas so //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'dod pas so //
translated: In order to teach the two stages, it is said ‚Äúby desire.‚Äù

original: brjod kyis mi lang ba'i zhes bya ba nas brtsams te drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes bya ba'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang ba'i zhes bya ba nas brtsams te drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes bya ba'i bar du ni snga ma bzhin du kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: khyed kyi sems zhes bya ba nas drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes bya ba'i bar du rim pa gnyis bshad par 'os pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Ah! up to non-intentional indicates the extremely clear explanation of reality.

original: de yang myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa'i ye shes kyi sku 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdzogs pa'i ye shes kyi sku 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is also desired to be explained by the wisdom body perfected through swift meditative concentration.

analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes pa nas rnam pa bzhi yis bshad ces bya ba'i bar du ni yi ge'i don gyis stong pa nyid bstan te /
translated: Up to non-entity and explained by the four indicates the explanation of emptiness by the meaning of the syllables.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi so sor bstan pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par bya bas so //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi so sor bstan pa'i sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par bya bas so //
translated: By the four doors of liberation, respectively, one should realize the reality of emptiness.

original: spyi'i don gyis ni mdo sde la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyod pa bzlog par bstan to //
analyzed: spyi'i don gyis ni mdo sde la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyod pa bzlog par bstan to //

original: sbas pa'i phyogs su ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: sbas pa'i phyogs su ni bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan pas so //
translated: By the hidden meaning, the stage of self-consecration is taught.

original: mthar thug pa'i phyogs su ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i phyogs su ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa bstan zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the ultimate meaning, the stage of union is taught.

original: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes pa'i bar du ni de kho na nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes pa'i bar du ni de kho na nyid gsal bar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By all things up to non-intentional, the reality is explained clearly.

original: @99a * // de kho na nyid ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: @99a * // de kho na nyid ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Reality is the completion stage.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs su bcad pa lnga pos rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga po ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi tshigs su bcad pa lnga pos rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga po ma nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the five verses on the thought of awakening, the five stages beginning with vajra repetition are taught without certainty.

original: de nas zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyag 'tshal btsam bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni phyag 'tshal btsam bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then up to just as it is explains the homage.

original: le'u gnyis pa'o zhes pas nye bar sdud pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gnyis pa'o zhes pas nye bar sdud pa bstan to //
translated: The second chapter indicates the summary.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas drang ba'i don dang zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang de rnams kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba nas drang ba'i don dang zhes bya ba'i bar du ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang de rnams kyi de kho na nyid bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then the BhagavƒÅn up to the provisional meaning explains the nature of the vajra body and so forth and the reality of those.

original: rin chen zhes bstan pa nas rnam pa bzhi yis bshad ces pa'i bar du ni de la spyi'i don gyi phyogs su gdong gi sna la thig le bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rin chen zhes bstan pa nas rnam pa bzhi yis bshad ces pa'i bar du ni de la spyi'i don gyi phyogs su gdong gi sna la thig le bsgom pa'o //
translated: The explanation by the fourfold classification of jewel up to explained is as follows: In the general sense, the bindu is meditated on the tip of the nose.

original: sbas pa'i phyogs su gsang ba'i chu skyes dang rdo rje'i rtse mor bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sbas pa'i phyogs su gsang ba'i chu skyes dang rdo rje'i rtse mor bsgom pa'o //

original: mthar thug pa'i phyogs su snying gi padma'i sna la bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i phyogs su snying gi padma'i sna la bsgom pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate sense, it is meditated on the tip of the lotus of the heart.

original: gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rigs can rnal 'byor pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: gti mug dang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi rigs can rnal 'byor pa'i dbye bas so //

analyzed: tshig re re'i bsdu ba dang chos mthun pa bshad pa ni yi ge'i don te thams cad du sbyor ro //
translated: The explanation of the concordance of the collection of each word is the meaning of the letters, which is applied everywhere.

original: nam mkha'i zhes pa drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes pa'i bar du ni rim pa gnyis 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes pa drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes pa'i bar du ni rim pa gnyis 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la bskyed pa'i rim pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lha'i tshogs bsgom pa'i gtsor gyur pa'o //
translated: Therein, the creation stage is the primary cultivation of the assembly of deities such as Vairocana.

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi 'char ba na rdo rje bzlas pa 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //

original: le'u gsum pa'i zhes pa 'dis nye bar sdud pa bstan to //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'i zhes pa 'dis nye bar sdud pa bstan to //
translated: With in the third chapter he teaches the summary.

original: de nas zhes pa nas sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa'i bar du ni bstod pa tsam gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa nas sgra ji bzhin pa zhes pa'i bar du ni bstod pa tsam gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa zhes pa'i sgras shes par bya'o zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa zhes pa'i sgras shes par bya'o zhes dgongs so //

analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa nas dgongs pa ma yin zhes pa'i bar du ni dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //

analyzed: de ltar na dkyil 'khor la sogs zhes bya ba 'dis sgra ji bzhin par ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / dkyil 'khor gyi tshad tsam dang dgod pa de dag tu sgra ji bzhin pa'o //

translated: Here, since this is the section on the reality of the ma·πá·∏çala, it is not the intended meaning.üîΩThen, the passage from the teacher up to the intended meaning is because only the ma·πá·∏çala of mind is expressed.

analyzed: de nas thugs zhes pa nas drang ba dang nges pa'i don zhes bya ba'i bar du ni mtshan ma'i phyag rgya dang bcas pa'i dkyil 'khor dang de kho na nyid kyang bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, the passage from mind up to the provisional and definitive meanings is because the ma·πá·∏çala with the sign seal and reality are also taught.

analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i zhes pa 'dis nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: The fourth chapter refers to the summary.

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba nas sgra ji bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du ni spyod pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //

analyzed: spyod pa ji lta ji ltar gsungs // zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du de kho na nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba nas dgongs pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i bar du de kho na nyid gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Then refers to the passage up to intentional explanation. original: rnam par dben pa zhes pa nas drang ba'i don dang nges pa'i don du bshad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni de la drang ba'i don gyi phyogs su rnam par dben pa dang ri'i mchog la sogs pa'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The passage from solitary up to explained as interpretable and definitive is as follows: In the interpretable sense, the solitary place, the mountain peak, and so on are taught.

translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe pristine wisdom of approach‚Äù up to ‚Äúexplained by the intention‚Äù teaches the six branches of yoga, which are characterized by the completion stage, which is expressed by the term ‚Äúcontradictory.‚Äù

translated: The passage from ‚Äúthe four times‚Äù up to ‚Äúexplained literally‚Äù teaches the divisions of time by the divisions of the inferior and so forth, by which the powers are taught. That should be understood by the term ‚Äúand so forth.‚Äù

original: gsang ba zhes pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni zla ba phyed la sogs pa'i 'gal ba'i sgras de kho na nyid thob par rab tu bstan pas so //

translated: The passage from secret up to explained by the intention is because of the teaching of the attainment of reality by the words half-month and so forth.

translated: Therein, the passage from there up to explained literally is because of the teaching of the mere supplication to the three, Body-vajra and so forth, which are the limbs of the great yoga.

translated: The word and so forth is intended to include the other two vajras.

translated: The passage from Ah! up to intentional explanation is because the reality of the six-branched yoga and so forth is taught by the contradictory terms Buddha and so forth.

original: ma skyes zhes pa nas dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyogs su yang bstan pa dang bstan bya'i sgo nas ye shes skye ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The passage from unborn up to non-intentional explanation is because the arising of gnosis is taught from the perspective of the taught and the teacher, even in the position of the naturelessness of the intrinsically pure essence.

original: yid 'ong zhes pa nas dgongs pas bshad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'gal ba'i sgras rdo rje bzlas pa bcu gcig so sor bstan pas so //

original: 'dod chags zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'dod chags zhes pa nas /

original: sgra ji bzhin pas bshad pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgras rigs can rnal 'byor pa rnams la rdo rje bzlas pa'i phan yon bstan pas so //

translated: From intuition up to the explanation of the literal meaning, the five extensive ritual actions of pacification and so on are taught by way of the bodies of the five Tathagatas, Vairochana and so on.
