translated: In the fourteenth chapter and so on means

original: phreng ba'i sngags rnams ni las kyi rab 'byams sgrub par byed ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sngags rnams ni las kyi rab 'byams sgrub par byed ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that the mantra garlands are called accomplishers of the infinite variety of activities.

original: las kyi rab 'byams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rab 'byams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The infinite variety of activities are the pacifying and so on.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni sogs pa'i sgra dang rtog pa'i sgra brjod pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni sogs pa'i sgra dang rtog pa'i sgra brjod pas so //
translated: The literal meaning is expressed by the word and so on and the word imagination.

original: bar bar na zhes pa ni skabs skabs su'o //
analyzed: bar bar na zhes pa ni skabs skabs su'o //
translated: Here and there means from time to time.

original: la la ni zhes pa la rim pa med par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: la la ni zhes pa la rim pa med par gnas pa'o //
translated: Some means without order.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa yang yod do zhes pa ni gang du 'gal ba'i sgras de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa yang yod do zhes pa ni gang du 'gal ba'i sgras de kho na nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: There is also an intentional explanation, which is where reality is taught by contradictory words.

original: de bzhin du le'u bco lnga pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtha' drug gi don kho na bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du le'u bco lnga pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtha' drug gi don kho na bstan to //
translated: Similarly, in the fifteenth chapter and so on, the meaning of the six limits is taught alone.

original: lus tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the validity of the body,

original: de ltar mdo'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ltar mdo'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said, Thus, the words of the sutra... and so on.

original: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rgyud las zhes pa ni rdo rje phreng ba las so //
translated: The tantra of explanation is the Vajra Garland.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation by the intention and so on have already been explained above.

original: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ces pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ces pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The yoga tantra is the meaning of the great yoga tantra.

original: de lta na yang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams las kyang mtha' drug mthong na rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kho na las ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud rnams las kyang mtha' drug mthong na rnal 'byor gyi rgyud kho na las ci'i phyir bshad ce na /
translated: Even so, if the six limits are seen in the yoginƒ´ tantras as well, why are they explained only in the yoga tantras?

original: de la bden te rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni thun mong yin la rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud thun mong ma yin zhes khyad par thams cad spyi'i dbang du song ba yin pas khyad par rnams @103b bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la bden te rnal 'byor gyi rgyud ni thun mong yin la rnal 'byor ma'i rgyud thun mong ma yin zhes khyad par thams cad spyi'i dbang du song ba yin pas khyad par rnams @103b bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: To that, it is true, but the yoga tantras are common, and the yoginƒ´ tantras are uncommon, and all the distinctions are subsumed under the general heading, so the distinctions should be summarized.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor rgyud ni mtha' drug can yin zhes pa'i tshig las 'grel ba 'di mtha' drug pa zhes mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor rgyud ni mtha' drug can yin zhes pa'i tshig las 'grel ba 'di mtha' drug pa zhes mi 'thad do //
translated: In that case, the statement the yoga tantra has six limits is not tenable as the title of this commentary, The Six Limits.

original: rgyan bdun pa zhes rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyan bdun pa zhes rigs pa yin te /
translated: It is reasonable to call it The Seven Ornaments,

original: de dag tshang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag tshang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they are complete.

original: smras pa gleng gzhi zhes bya ba ni tshig thams cad du bshad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: smras pa gleng gzhi zhes bya ba ni tshig thams cad du bshad par bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said that the nidana is to be explained as all the words,

original: gang gi phyir nges brjod pa la sogs pa lnga ston gyi tshig re re la ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nges brjod pa la sogs pa lnga ston gyi tshig re re la ni mi 'jug go //
translated: because it is the teaching of the five, such as the declaration, and not the engagement of each word.

original: rigs pa yang tshig re re la smra bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa yang tshig re re la smra bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Reason is also not to be stated for each word,

original: gleng bslang ba bzhin du de yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gleng bslang ba bzhin du de yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like the introduction, it is of the nature of that.

original: 'chad pa po'i rgyan yang logs pa ma yin te ma gtogs par bshad pa dbye ba ma 'grub pas so //
analyzed: 'chad pa po'i rgyan yang logs pa ma yin te ma gtogs par bshad pa dbye ba ma 'grub pas so //
translated: The ornament of the expounder is not otherwise, because the explanation is not established without it.

original: nyan pa po'i rgyan yang rten med pa ma yin te de'i rten mtha' drug yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan pa po'i rgyan yang rten med pa ma yin te de'i rten mtha' drug yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ornament of the listener is not without a basis, because its basis is the six limits.üîΩThe meaning of the six limits is taught individually, and the order is the establishment of the ornament that includes all the topics to be explained without exception, called the Ornament of the Middle Way.

original: mtha' drug gi don so sor bstan pa nyid kyi rim pa gnyis sdud par byed pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don ma lus pa bsdu ba'i rgyan zhes bya ba 'grub po zhes don gyi shugs kyis tshig re re la mtha' drug gis bshad pas de'i ming gis 'grel
analyzed: mtha' drug gi don so sor bstan pa nyid kyi rim pa gnyis sdud par byed pa'i brjod par bya ba'i don ma lus pa bsdu ba'i rgyan zhes bya ba 'grub po zhes don gyi shugs kyis tshig re re la mtha' drug gis bshad pas de'i ming gis 'grel
translated: Thus, by the force of the meaning, the six limits are explained for each word, and by its name, the explanation is established.

original: bar grangs so //
analyzed: bar grangs so //
translated: The middle number.

original: de ltar na bshad pa rnam pa bzhi yang tshig re re la lnga lngar yod pas zhes mtha' drug gis bshad pa mi rigs she na /
analyzed: de ltar na bshad pa rnam pa bzhi yang tshig re re la lnga lngar yod pas zhes mtha' drug gis bshad pa mi rigs she na /
translated: Thus, if each of the four explanations has five parts, then it is not correct to explain the six parameters.

original: smras pa dang / gzhan gyi brjod pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: smras pa dang / gzhan gyi brjod pas nyes pa med do //
translated: It is said that there is no fault in the expression of others.

original: dper na ma'i bu dang pha'i bu zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ma'i bu dang pha'i bu zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the son of a mother and the son of a father.

original: gang gi phyir gnyi ga la 'byung ba de cig shos kyi ming gis kyang grags pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnyi ga la 'byung ba de cig shos kyi ming gis kyang grags pa yin no //
translated: Because both occur, it is also known by the name of the other.

original: de bas na rim pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na rim pa 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that by this very sequence.

original: mtha' drug tu bshad pa dang rnam pa bzhir bshad pa zhes pa ni mtha' drug dang bshad pa rnam pa bzhis bzung bas rgyan gzhan rnams de dag tu 'dus pas so //
analyzed: mtha' drug tu bshad pa dang rnam pa bzhir bshad pa zhes pa ni mtha' drug dang bshad pa rnam pa bzhis bzung bas rgyan gzhan rnams de dag tu 'dus pas so //
translated: The explanation of the six parameters and the explanation of the four aspects is taken by the six parameters and the four explanations, because the other ornaments are included in them.üîΩThe meaning of the glorious Guhyasamaja is sealed.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i don rgyas btab pa yin la zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen pos de dag gis rgyas btab pa ni bcings pa'o //
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i don rgyas btab pa yin la zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen pos de dag gis rgyas btab pa ni bcings pa'o //
translated: The lord of the tathagatas, Great Vajradhara, sealed them, which is to say, he bound them.

original: des na rtogs par dka' ba'i rgyud 'di yin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des na rtogs par dka' ba'i rgyud 'di yin zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, this tantra is difficult to understand.

original: de ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis da ltar byung ba rnams kyis mi rtogs zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis da ltar byung ba rnams kyis mi rtogs zhes bstan to //
translated: By except for that, it is taught that those who have not attained the stage of acceptance will not understand it.

original: sgra ji bzhin par bshad pa'i sgra'i don tsam la brten te zhes pa ni mtha' drug gi don mi shes nas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin par bshad pa'i sgra'i don tsam la brten te zhes pa ni mtha' drug gi don mi shes nas so //
translated: By based on the mere meaning of the words explained literally, it means that without knowing the meaning of the six parameters,

original: 'gal ba dang shin tu rmad du gyur pa'i bya ba byed pas ni lta ba la @104a * //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang shin tu rmad du gyur pa'i bya ba byed pas ni lta ba la @104a * //
translated: one will engage in contradictory and extremely amazing actions due to the power of view and so forth.

original: sogs pa'i dbang gis ma dang sring mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgra ji bzhin du gzung bas 'gal ba spyod pas so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dbang gis ma dang sring mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgra ji bzhin du gzung bas 'gal ba spyod pas so //
translated: By mother and sister, and so on, one engages in contradictions by taking it literally.

original: las kyi dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi dbang du 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: By one will come under the power of karma,

original: sdig pa'i las kun tu spyod pas mnar med pa la sogs par skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: sdig pa'i las kun tu spyod pas mnar med pa la sogs par skye bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: it means that by engaging in sinful actions, one will be born in Avici Hell and so on.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: Moreover, by the Bhagavan, and so on, it shows the validity of scripture.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po zhes pa ni bong ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po zhes pa ni bong ba'i tshig go //
translated: By Lord of Secrets, it is a word of praise.

original: tshul chen 'di ni rnyed gyur nas //
analyzed: tshul chen 'di ni rnyed gyur nas //
translated: Having found this great way,

original: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnal 'byor gyi rgyud chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the great yoga tantra.

original: zad min don ni sgra ji bzhin pa yin zhes tha tshig go //
analyzed: zad min don ni sgra ji bzhin pa yin zhes tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot exhausted‚Äù is just as the words are, this is the meaning.

original: lam ngan pa zhes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i lam du'o //
analyzed: lam ngan pa zhes pa ni so so'i skye bo'i lam du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBad path‚Äù is in the path of the ordinary person.

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rig pa'i dbang tsam thob nas sgrub pa'i thabs tsam yongs su shes pas nga rgyal dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes tha tshig go //üîΩchos ni g-yo yis byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rig pa'i dbang tsam thob nas sgrub pa'i thabs tsam yongs su shes pas nga rgyal dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes tha tshig go // chos ni g-yo yis byed par 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúArrogance‚Äù and so forth means that having attained just the power of knowledge, through merely understanding the means of practice, one becomes arrogant. This is the meaning.üîΩ‚ÄúDharma is done with deceit‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni g-yo sgyu'i dbang gis chos byed pa ste so bya bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni g-yo sgyu'i dbang gis chos byed pa ste so bya bzhin no //
translated: means that Dharma is done under the influence of deceit, like a rat.

original: sems can slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i do n to //
analyzed: sems can slu bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i do n to //
translated: ‚ÄúDeceiving sentient beings‚Äù is the meaning.

original: des ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam tshig nyams pa dang yongs su mi shes pa dag bstan to //
analyzed: des ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dam tshig nyams pa dang yongs su mi shes pa dag bstan to //
translated: By that, ‚Äúassembly‚Äù and so forth teach the impairment of samaya and complete non-understanding.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje slob dpon la smod par byed pa bstan to //üîΩskad cig ces pa nas byams pa'i sems med pa dang / bgrod min la 'gro ba dang / mtshams med pa byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la spyod par byed pa ston par byed do //üîΩde nyid ye shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje slob dpon la smod par byed pa bstan to // skad cig ces pa nas byams pa'i sems med pa dang / bgrod min la 'gro ba dang / mtshams med pa byed pa dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la spyod par byed pa ston par byed do // de nyid ye shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The words directly and so on teach the disparagement of the vajra master.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa lhag par mos pa'i sbyor bas stong pa nyid mngon du byed pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩting nge 'dzin ni rim pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //üîΩrtogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnyes pa cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te slong mo'i khyim nas gal te bza' ba tsam ma rnyed na de'i tshe /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa lhag par mos pa'i sbyor bas stong pa nyid mngon du byed pa dang / rdzogs pa'i rim pa la rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //üîΩting nge 'dzin ni rim pa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid do //üîΩrtogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //üîΩnyes pa cung zad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te slong mo'i khyim nas gal te bza' ba tsam ma rnyed na de'i tshe /
translated: The words moment and so on teach the disparagement of the master who is a knower of reality, who is a knower of the world, who is a knower of the sutras, who is a knower of the tantras, who is a knower of the treatises, who is a knower of the ritual, who is a knower of the mandala, who is a knower of the rite, who is a knower of the stages, who is a knower of the mantras, who is a knower of the mudras, who is a knower of the ma·πá·∏çala, who is a knower of the mandala rites, who is a knower of the mantras, who is a knower of the mantras and mudras, who is a knower of the mantras and the stages, who is a knower of the mantras and the rites, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala and the ma·πá·∏çala rites, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala, who is a knower of the mantras and the ma·πá·∏çala rites and the stages and the rites and the ma·πá·∏çala and the ma·πá·∏ç

original: le'u gsum pa la sogs pa nas gsungs pa'i mngon spyod kyi las byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: le'u gsum pa la sogs pa nas gsungs pa'i mngon spyod kyi las byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should perform the rites of violence taught in the third chapter, etc.

original: gal te des grub par gyur na de'i tshe skyon med do //
analyzed: gal te des grub par gyur na de'i tshe skyon med do //
translated: If one does not succeed, then there is no fault.

original: 'on kyang @104b rnal 'byor ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'on kyang @104b rnal 'byor ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: However, yoga is the meditative concentration of the stage of generation.

original: sbyor ba ni rdzas la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rdzas la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application is the application of the substances, etc., just as they are.

original: de dag gi dman pa ni bral ba'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi dman pa ni bral ba'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is deficient in those, one will not succeed because of being separated from them.

original: sngags pa ni bshad pa'i tshig ste blun po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngags pa ni bshad pa'i tshig ste blun po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The mantra practitioner is the one who explains the words, and the meaning is the fool.

original: de yi sbyor ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis sgom pa med pas rang gi bstan pa la skur ba 'debs shing /
analyzed: de yi sbyor ba la mkhas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis sgom pa med pas rang gi bstan pa la skur ba 'debs shing /
translated: By this, skilled in his application, etc., he is without meditation, and so he denigrates his own teaching.

original: phyi'i bstan bcos la brten te de'i sbyor ba slob pas rang gi dam tshig dang bral zhing rang dbang du song bas sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor bas 'tsho ba tshol zhing /
analyzed: phyi'i bstan bcos la brten te de'i sbyor ba slob pas rang gi dam tshig dang bral zhing rang dbang du song bas sngags la sogs pa'i sbyor bas 'tsho ba tshol zhing /
translated: Relying on external treatises, he learns their application, and so he is separated from his own commitments and goes his own way, seeking a livelihood through the application of mantras, etc.

original: gang du rnyed pa yod pa de nyid du 'jug par 'gyur te bzo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: gang du rnyed pa yod pa de nyid du 'jug par 'gyur te bzo bo bzhin no //
translated: He will enter into that very place where there is gain, like a craftsman.

original: de rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: For the sake of taking care of them,

original: gsang ba dgongs pas bshad pa yin //
analyzed: gsang ba dgongs pas bshad pa yin //
translated: it is taught with a secret intention.

original: zhes pa ni sems can de rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dgongs pas lung bstan te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can de rnams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir dgongs pas lung bstan te /
translated: This is a prediction with an intention for the sake of taking care of those sentient beings.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi dka' ba'i tshig phye nas ji lta ba bzhin du don nges par gzung bas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi dka' ba'i tshig phye nas ji lta ba bzhin du don nges par gzung bas so //
translated: Having explained the difficult words of the root tantra, the meaning is ascertained just as it is.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag gi don dbye bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas yan lag gi don dbye bar bya ba'i phyir bshad par byed de /
translated: In this way, and so on, is explained in order to analyze the meaning of the branches.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi'i tshig gi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi'i tshig gi gnas skabs so //
translated: Here, and so on, is the context of the introductory words.

original: sdud pa po 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni le'u bcu bdun pa las kye'i rdo rje chos kyi rnam grangs 'di long shig ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdud pa po 'phags pa phyag na rdo rje zhes pa ni le'u bcu bdun pa las kye'i rdo rje chos kyi rnam grangs 'di long shig ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The compiler is noble VajrapƒÅ·πái, as it will be explained in chapter seventeen: Take up this Dharma discourse of Hevajra.

original: de bas ni sdud pa por gyur pa ni chos kyi mdzod de nyid la gtad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas ni sdud pa por gyur pa ni chos kyi mdzod de nyid la gtad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the one who is the compiler, in order to entrust the very treasury of the Dharma,

original: 'di skad bya ba tshig gi phrad kyis rgyud kyi don ma lus pa mtshon par byed pa ni rgyud kyi don ma lus pa sems la bzhag nas 'di skad ces gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di skad bya ba tshig gi phrad kyis rgyud kyi don ma lus pa mtshon par byed pa ni rgyud kyi don ma lus pa sems la bzhag nas 'di skad ces gsungs te /
translated: The phrase thus have I heard indicates the entire meaning of the tantra with a single word, and having placed the entire meaning of the tantra in the mind, it is said thus.

original: tshig phrad rnams la don du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig phrad rnams la don du ma yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the words have many meanings.

original: bdag nyid kyis ni dngos su thos kyi brgyud pas ni ma yin zhes bya ba la dngos su thos pas 'khrul pa med pa nyid ston te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ni dngos su thos kyi brgyud pas ni ma yin zhes bya ba la dngos su thos pas 'khrul pa med pa nyid ston te /
translated: It is said directly by myself, not indirectly, and this shows that there is no error in the direct hearing.

original: brgyud pa'i sgo nas thos pa la ni de las gzhan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brgyud pa'i sgo nas thos pa la ni de las gzhan par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is different from that which is heard indirectly.

original: rtogs pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni thos pa tsam gtso bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni thos pa tsam gtso bo yin pas so //
translated: It is said not realized, because the mere hearing is primary.

original: rtogs pa yod na bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi nges pa rnyed nas de'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa yod na bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab kyi nges pa rnyed nas de'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is realization, then having obtained certainty through the wisdom of meditation, one abides in the nature of that.

original: sdud pas ci zhig bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdud pas ci zhig bya zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the use of the compilation? This is the meaning.

original: dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pa 'dis thos pa mang ba la sogs pa yon tan gsum bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dus gcig na zhes pa la sogs pa 'dis thos pa mang ba la sogs pa yon tan gsum bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase at one time and so forth indicates the three qualities of the compiler: great learning, excellent wisdom, and great compassion.

original: rgyud kyi dkon pa nyid ni rgyud kyi yon tan no //
analyzed: rgyud kyi dkon pa nyid ni rgyud kyi yon tan no //
translated: The greatness of the tantra is the quality of the tantra.

original: @105a * // thos pa mang ba dang shes rab phul du byung ba dag ni sdud pa po'i yon tan no //
analyzed: @105a * // thos pa mang ba dang shes rab phul du byung ba dag ni sdud pa po'i yon tan no //
translated: Great learning and excellent wisdom are the qualities of the compiler.

original: gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi gsungs so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi gsungs so //
translated: The statement beginning with from whom is the nidana.

original: gang gi phyir ston pa dang gnas dang nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gleng gzhi yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ston pa dang gnas dang nyan pa phun sum tshogs pa gtso bo yin pa'i phyir gleng gzhi yin no //
translated: Because the teacher, place, and audience are perfect, it is the nidana.

original: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pas rgyud kyi che ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de la ston pa phun sum tshogs pas rgyud kyi che ba nyid bstan to //
translated: There, the perfection of the teacher teaches the greatness of the tantra.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yongs su dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su tshad bstan pas tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yongs su dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su tshad bstan pas tshad ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection of the place, being completely pure, teaches the measure of the buddhafields.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pas 'di dang lhan cig thos zhes pas dbang po nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pas 'di dang lhan cig thos zhes pas dbang po nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The perfection of the audience, by the phrase heard together with, teaches the faculty.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One is taught by ‚Äúthe Blessed One‚Äù and so forth.

original: skal pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
analyzed: skal pa dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with good fortune‚Äù means

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said:

original: dbang phyug ma lus pa nyid dang // ye shes dang ni grags pa dpal //
analyzed: dbang phyug ma lus pa nyid dang // ye shes dang ni grags pa dpal //
translated: Omniscience, knowledge, fame, glory,

original: chags bral rtsol ba nyid dang ni //üîΩbcom pa rnam pa drug tu grags //
analyzed: chags bral rtsol ba nyid dang ni // bcom pa rnam pa drug tu grags //
translated: freedom from attachment, effort,

original: zhes pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes pa 'byung bas so //
translated: and destruction are known as the six perfections.

original: de rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Since he is endowed with those, he is the Blessed One.

original: mi mthun pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of adversaries:

original: phyi dang nang gi dag go //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dag go //
translated: outer and inner.

original: de la phyi'i ni lha'i gu la sogs pa'i bdud rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la phyi'i ni lha'i gu la sogs pa'i bdud rnams kyi'o //
translated: Among them, the outer are the mƒÅras such as Devaputra.

original: de rnams rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bcom pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: de rnams rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bcom pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Since he has destroyed them with the vajra-like samƒÅdhi, he is the Blessed One.

original: nang gi ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang las dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba de rnams mthong ba dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: nang gi ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya dang las dang rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa zhes bya ba de rnams mthong ba dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis bcom pas na bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The internal is the afflictions, the obscurations of the knowable, the obscurations of karma, and the obscurations of ripening. Since he has conquered those by the stages of seeing, meditation, and so forth, he is the BhagavƒÅn.

original: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa las kyang //
translated: Also, in the Prakara·πáa:

original: skye rengs 'char ba'i dus su ni //
analyzed: skye rengs 'char ba'i dus su ni //
translated: At the time of the rising sun,

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis //
translated: through the vajra-like samƒÅdhi,

original: byang chub shing drung bzhugs nas ni //
analyzed: byang chub shing drung bzhugs nas ni //
translated: dwelling at the foot of the enlightenment tree,

original: des ni bdud rnams 'joms par mdzad //
analyzed: des ni bdud rnams 'joms par mdzad //
translated: he conquers the mƒÅras.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said.

original: ji srid yid ni g-yo 'gyur bas //
analyzed: ji srid yid ni g-yo 'gyur bas //
translated: As long as the mind wavers,

original: de srid bdud kyi spyod yul yin //
analyzed: de srid bdud kyi spyod yul yin //
translated: for that long it is the domain of mƒÅra.

original: de ltar yod pas skyon med ni //
analyzed: de ltar yod pas skyon med ni //
translated: Since it exists in that way,

original: 'di ni ci phyir rigs pa min //
analyzed: 'di ni ci phyir rigs pa min //
translated: this is not reasonable.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said.

original: kyang gi sgras ni ma bshad pa bsdu ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni ma bshad pa bsdu ba'i don yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that it includes what was not explained.

original: de nas bcom ni chos 'byung ba'i nang du bde ba chen po'i tshul lam thig le'i gzugs su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nas bcom ni chos 'byung ba'i nang du bde ba chen po'i tshul lam thig le'i gzugs su gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Then, after conquering, he abides in the form of the method of great bliss or the bindu inside the source of phenomena.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes spyi'i don gyi phyogs su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes spyi'i don gyi phyogs su 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Bhagavat is explained in terms of the general meaning.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin te zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang du bzhugs @105b zhes 'dri ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa yin te zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das gang du bzhugs @105b zhes 'dri ba la /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe excellence of the place is taught by the words ‚Äòall tathƒÅgatas,‚Äô and so forth‚Äù is the question, ‚ÄúIn what place did the Bhagavat dwell?‚Äù

original: rgyud gang du bshad par der bzhugs zhes lan no //
analyzed: rgyud gang du bshad par der bzhugs zhes lan no //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúIn the place where the tantra is explained.‚Äù

original: de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'am mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'am mkhyen pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTathƒÅgata‚Äù means ‚Äúgone to suchness,‚Äù which is to say, ‚Äúentered into clear light‚Äù or ‚Äúknown.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten gnyis kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po snod dang bcud kyi 'jig rten gnyis kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTathƒÅgata‚Äù and so forth is because Great Vajradhara is the essence of both the world and its inhabitants.

original: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
analyzed: mgon po sems can kun bdag nyid //
translated: The protector is the nature of all sentient beings.

original: ces rab tu byed pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces rab tu byed pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it occurs in the chapter on the subject.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi snying po ste /
translated: The essence of the body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great Vajradhara is because of being completely perfected by all the Tathagatas.

original: gang gi phyir rigs lnga phung po lnga rnam par dag par gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs lnga phung po lnga rnam par dag par gsungs te /
translated: Because of the five families and the five aggregates being taught as pure,

original: de dag kho na sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye bas gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kho na sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye bas gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: they become three by the division of body, speech, and mind.

original: de rnams kyang 'od gsal ba la nye bar bsdus pas rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs gcig po kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'od gsal ba la nye bar bsdus pas rdo rje sems dpa'i rigs gcig po kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: And those are subsumed into clear light, so they become only the one family of Vajrasattva.

original: de bas rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be Great Vajradhara.

original: shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam par dag pa'i spros pa las nges par grol ba thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya'i rnam par dag pa'i spros pa las nges par grol ba thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid dpal rdo rje sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term Glorious Vajrasattva is the nature of the emptiness of all things, definitely liberated from the elaborations of the purity of the object of knowledge and the knower.

original: de'i rdo rje btsun mo ni shes rab ste zhes pa la 'od gsal ba'i de kho nyid mngon du byed pa rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par rtogs par bya ba bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ste stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i
analyzed: de'i rdo rje btsun mo ni shes rab ste zhes pa la 'od gsal ba'i de kho nyid mngon du byed pa rnal 'byor gyi mngon sum gyi tshad mas yang dag par rtogs par bya ba bsgom pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab ste stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù is the wisdom that has the nature of meditation, which is to be realized by the valid knowledge of the direct perception of yoga that manifests the reality of clear light.üîΩThat itself is the bhaga, because it conquers the afflictions.

original: don to // de nyid nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms pas na bha ga'o zhes gsum dang de dang 'brel ba'i chags bral la sogs pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: don to // de nyid nyon mongs pa rnams 'joms pas na bha ga'o zhes gsum dang de dang 'brel ba'i chags bral la sogs pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The one hundred and sixty natures of detachment and so on that are related to that are the afflictions.

original: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas bcom zhing rnam par dag pas na bha ga zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas bcom zhing rnam par dag pas na bha ga zhes bshad do //
translated: Since they are conquered and purified by the stages of mantra and mudra, they are explained to be the bhaga.üîΩThis is taught:

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te zhes pa 'dis nye bar sdud par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te zhes pa 'dis nye bar sdud par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the summary.

original: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis bgegs bskrad par byas nas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis bgegs bskrad par byas nas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid bsgoms te /
translated: With suchness and so on, having expelled the obstructors, one meditates on emptiness, which is the nature of the gnosis of the dharmadhatu.

original: slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin ye shes kyis sa gzhi byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin ye shes kyis sa gzhi byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Again, bless the ground with the nature of the five transcendent ones with the nature of exalted wisdom.

original: de'i steng du ri rab yongs su gyur pa'i gzhal yas khang pa'i nang du myur du lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsams la /üîΩrdo rje phreng ba las @106a * //
analyzed: de'i steng du ri rab yongs su gyur pa'i gzhal yas khang pa'i nang du myur du lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsams la / rdo rje phreng ba las @106a * //
translated: In the center of the celestial mansion that is the complete transformation of Mount Meru, imagine the mandala of swift clear realization.

original: gsungs pa'i rim pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor la dmigs shing stong pa nyid kyi sngags mngon du byas te /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rim pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor la dmigs shing stong pa nyid kyi sngags mngon du byas te /
translated: In accordance with the stages taught in the Vajra Garland, visualize the ultimate mandala, and actualize the mantra of emptiness.

original: yi ge gsum spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma bsams la slar yang de'i steng du yi ge gsum bkod la /
analyzed: yi ge gsum spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma bsams la slar yang de'i steng du yi ge gsum bkod la /
translated: Through the process of emanating and reabsorbing the three syllables, imagine a lotus, moon, and sun. Again, on top of that, arrange the three syllables.

original: de yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du sngar bshad pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa de nyid du 'jug par byas la /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor du sngar bshad pa'i nyi ma la sogs pa de nyid du 'jug par byas la /
translated: Those completely transform into a moon mandala, and the previously explained sun and so forth enter into that.

original: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas rang gi sems brtan par byas la /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings zhes bya ba'i sngags brjod pa sngon du 'gro bas rang gi sems brtan par byas la /
translated: Having stabilized one's mind with the recitation of the mantra called the dhƒÅtu of phenomena preceding that,

original: slar yang zla ba de la yi ge gsum bkod cing de nyid las spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa sa bon dang bcas par bsams la /
analyzed: slar yang zla ba de la yi ge gsum bkod cing de nyid las spro ba dang bsdu ba'i rim pas rdo rje dkar po rtse lnga pa sa bon dang bcas par bsams la /
translated: Again, one should visualize the three syllables on the moon, and from that, through the process of emanating and reabsorbing, a white five-pronged vajra together with the seed syllable.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed la de'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs kar ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' bskyed la de'i thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' de'i thugs kar ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' rnam par bsgoms te /
translated: From that transformation, one should generate Bhagavat Vajrasattva, and in his heart, the gnosis being, and in his heart, the concentration being.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sa bon rnam par dgod pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs par byas la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i sa bon rnam par dgod pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu rnal 'byor rdzogs par byas la /
translated: Having completed the very unelaborate yoga, which has the characteristic of the placement of the seed syllables of the bodhisattvas on the sense organs such as the eyes,

original: sku gsung thugs kyi byin gyis rlob pa'i mtshan nyid can rnal 'byor chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas pa dang / padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhal gsum la sogs pa'i rnam pa can rdo rje 'chang chen pos rgyud gsungs so zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi byin gyis rlob pa'i mtshan nyid can rnal 'byor chen po yongs su rdzogs par byas pa dang / padma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhal gsum la sogs pa'i rnam pa can rdo rje 'chang chen pos rgyud gsungs so zhes dgongs so //
translated: one should complete the great yoga, which has the characteristic of the consecration of body, speech, and mind, and one should imagine that Great Vajradhara, having three faces and so forth, on the top of a lotus and moon mandala, teaches the tantra.

original: yi ge'i don te zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ston pa la dang po'i sbyor ba tsam tshig gi sbyor bas ston pa dang sgra la rnam par zhen pa rnams la 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams su bya ba dang byed pa dang bsdu
analyzed: yi ge'i don te zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ston pa la dang po'i sbyor ba tsam tshig gi sbyor bas ston pa dang sgra la rnam par zhen pa rnams la 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa rnams su bya ba dang byed pa dang bsdu
translated: The meaning of the syllables is that in order to teach the creation stage, the mere initial application is taught by the application of words, and for those who are attached to words, it is said, ‚ÄúThis is called‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.üîΩ

original: ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba la sogs pa bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the syllables is that in teaching the creation stage, the mere initial application is taught by the application of words, and for those who are attached to sound, it is explained as this is called and so on, in order to explain the agent, action, and collection, and so on.

original: tshogs pa la bshad pa'i zhes pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa de'i yang gcig gis kyang tha snyad du rigs te /
analyzed: tshogs pa la bshad pa'i zhes pa ni yan lag lnga dang ldan pa de'i yang gcig gis kyang tha snyad du rigs te /
translated: The explanation of the collection is that even one of those endowed with five limbs is suitable conventionally,

original: tshig rnams la tshig gi phyogs gcig yod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig rnams la tshig gi phyogs gcig yod do zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that in the words, one part of the words exists.

original: dper na yul tshig pa dang snam bu tshig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yul tshig pa dang snam bu tshig pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a burned country and a burned cloth.

original: da ni spyi'i don gyi skabs la dang po rgol ba dang lan gyi sgo nas so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni spyi'i don gyi skabs la dang po rgol ba dang lan gyi sgo nas so sor bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in the section on the general meaning, in order to individually demonstrate by way of the objection and response,

original: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: it is said, Here it is said... and so on.

original: dgongs pa gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa gang gis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: By what intention? and so forth, the intention is this:

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag rjod par byed pa de dang 'dir zhes sgra gnyis po yod na 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ci'i phyir gzung @106b zhe na ;
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba dag rjod par byed pa de dang 'dir zhes sgra gnyis po yod na 'di skad ces bya ba'i tshig gi phrad ci'i phyir gzung @106b zhe na ;
translated: If the two words then and here exist, which express the past and present, why is the enclitic iti not taken?

original: smras pa zhes bya ba 'dis lan yin no //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba 'dis lan yin no //
translated: This is the reply: Thus.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo dang bcas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni spyan la sogs pa lha mo dang bcas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: All the Tathagatas are the goddesses such as Locana and so forth.

original: brdar gyur pa ni brda tsam nyid du bzung ba'o //
analyzed: brdar gyur pa ni brda tsam nyid du bzung ba'o //
translated: The symbolic means is taken as mere symbol.

original: de bas na thabs dang shes rab ston pa nyid kyis na zhes pa ni stong pa nying dang snying rje'i de kho na nyid thob par byed pa bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dang / rdo rje dang padma dang de dag gi snyoms par zhugs pa las skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rjod par byed pa zhes bar du'o //
analyzed: de bas na thabs dang shes rab ston pa nyid kyis na zhes pa ni stong pa nying dang snying rje'i de kho na nyid thob par byed pa bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dang / rdo rje dang padma dang de dag gi snyoms par zhugs pa las skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rjod par byed pa zhes bar du'o //
translated: Therefore, by the teaching of means and insight, and so forth, is the establishment of the means of attaining the reality of emptiness and compassion, the object of attainment and the means of attainment, the vajra and lotus, and the great bliss born from their union, which is the expression.

original: smras pa gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud pa po yod par mi 'gyur te zhes bstan to //
analyzed: smras pa gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud pa po yod par mi 'gyur te zhes bstan to //
translated: The response beginning with If that is so, etc., demonstrates that the compiler would not exist.

original: sdud pa po med ces dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: sdud pa po med ces dam bca' ba'o //
translated: The thesis is the compiler does not exist.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir zhes gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is because there is no connection.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa 'dis thabs dang shes rab mtshon par byed pas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs can gyi las med pas 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa 'dis thabs dang shes rab mtshon par byed pas bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i byed pa po dang bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs can gyi las med pas 'brel pa med do //
translated: The idea is this: since this thus have I heard indicates method and wisdom, there is no connection because there is no agent, action, etc., that is a synonym for the action of thus have I heard, etc.

original: de bas na bdag gis thos zhes sdud par byed pa po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gis thos zhes sdud par byed pa po med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it follows that there is no compiler who says thus have I heard.

original: rgyud kyi don yang mchog tu 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes dri'o //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don yang mchog tu 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes dri'o //
translated: It is asked, One would not hold the meaning of the tantra as supreme.

original: de ni bden te smras pa zhes pa ni bden te zhes pa 'dis lan no //
analyzed: de ni bden te smras pa zhes pa ni bden te zhes pa 'dis lan no //
translated: The response beginning with That is true, etc., is the response with That is true.

original: 'dir sdud par byed pa po ni med do zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis 'chad pa po yang yin la nyan pa po yang yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sdud par byed pa po ni med do zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku nyid kyis 'chad pa po yang yin la nyan pa po yang yin no //
translated: This is because Vajradhara himself, by means of the enjoyment and emanation bodies, is both the expounder and the hearer.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo ba de dang tha mi dad pa'i sprul pa phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa sdud pa po rnams la the tshom med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin las mi g-yo ba de dang tha mi dad pa'i sprul pa phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa sdud pa po rnams la the tshom med na /
translated: Since there is no doubt for the compilers such as VajrapƒÅ·πái, who are emanations inseparable from him, the essence of all emptiness, Vajradhara, who does not move from the meditative concentration of union,

original: gang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir de rnams la rdo rje 'chang chen pos chos bstan pa dang de rnams kyis kyang de las thos nas gzhan rnams la so sor bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang bzlog par bya ba'i phyir de rnams la rdo rje 'chang chen pos chos bstan pa dang de rnams kyis kyang de las thos nas gzhan rnams la so sor bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: for the sake of what is to be reversed, the Dharma is taught by MahƒÅvajradhara to them, and having heard it from him, they will teach it individually to others.

original: de bas na ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams gdon par byed pa'i bsam pas sna tshogs pa sangs rgyas kyi rol ston 'di bstan to zhes 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po tha dad pa gang zhig yod /üîΩde'i phyir spros pa med pa rdo rje 'chang chen po gcig pu nyid rdo rje 'chang chen pos dbang du byas pa'i thugs kyi rgyud kyi 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dang sdud @107a * //
analyzed: de bas na ma 'ongs pa'i sems can gyi khams gdon par byed pa'i bsam pas sna tshogs pa sangs rgyas kyi rol ston 'di bstan to zhes 'chad pa po dang nyan pa po tha dad pa gang zhig yod / de'i phyir spros pa med pa rdo rje 'chang chen po gcig pu nyid rdo rje 'chang chen pos dbang du byas pa'i thugs kyi rgyud kyi 'chad pa po dang / nyan pa po dang sdud @107a * //
translated: What is the difference between the expounder and the listener?

original: pa po'i dbye bas bdag nyid kho na rab tu ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa po'i dbye bas bdag nyid kho na rab tu ston par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, the single Great Vajradhara, free from conceptual elaborations, is the expounder of the mind tantra controlled by Great Vajradhara, and he himself manifests as the division of the listener and the compiler.

original: de lta na smras pa ni 'o na btsun pa kun dga' bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas slar yang 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na smras pa ni 'o na btsun pa kun dga' bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas slar yang 'dri ba'o //
translated: Thus, it is said. Then, Venerable Ananda, and so on, is the question again.

original: de'i bsam pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las btsun pa kun dga' bo ni sdud pa po ste /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las btsun pa kun dga' bo ni sdud pa po ste /
translated: His thought is that in the noble Perfection of Wisdom, Venerable Ananda is the compiler,

original: de bzhin du yang mdo sde dang rgyud kyi rgyal po gzhan rnams la yang 'od srungs dang mod gal gyi bu la sogs pa sdud pa po yod ces ci'i phyir 'dir sdud pa po med ces smras she na /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang mdo sde dang rgyud kyi rgyal po gzhan rnams la yang 'od srungs dang mod gal gyi bu la sogs pa sdud pa po yod ces ci'i phyir 'dir sdud pa po med ces smras she na /
translated: Likewise, in other s≈´tras and tantra kings, there are compilers such as KƒÅ≈õyapa and MaudgalyƒÅyana. Why is it said here that there is no compiler?

original: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan yin te /
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan yin te /
translated: The response is with ‚ÄúMaudgalyƒÅyana‚Äù and so on.üîΩHere, ƒÄnanda is the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva Samantabhadra.

original: kun dga' bo ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po ste zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod rnams la gang btsun pa kun dga' bo sdud pa po yin pa de nyid sngags kyi bstan pa 'di la kun tu bzang po
analyzed: kun dga' bo ni 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po ste zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod rnams la gang btsun pa kun dga' bo sdud pa po yin pa de nyid sngags kyi bstan pa 'di la kun tu bzang po
translated: In the pi·π≠aka of the hearers, he is the venerable ƒÄnanda, the compiler. In this teaching of mantra, he is called Samantabhadra.

original: zhes bya'o // sngags kyi theg pa la sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid de /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // sngags kyi theg pa la sdud pa po phyag na rdo rje gang yin pa de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid de /
translated: In the mantra vehicle, the compiler is VajrapƒÅ·πái, who is Great Vajradhara.

original: longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku dag ni dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod dang sprul pa'i sku dag ni dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the enjoyment body and the emanation body are inseparable.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag dbyer med pa la tshad ma nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag dbyer med pa la tshad ma nyid gsungs so //
translated: Otherwise, etc. states the validity of their inseparability.

original: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod kyi tshad do //
analyzed: chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong zhes pa ni nyan thos kyi sde snod kyi tshad do //
translated: The eighty-four thousand aggregates of Dharma is the measure of the Sravaka canon.

original: nye bar mtshon pa yin pas theg pa chen po ni stong phrag dgu bcu rdo rje theg pa yang zhes pa ni yang gi sgras ni khri phrag bcu'i chad can no //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa yin pas theg pa chen po ni stong phrag dgu bcu rdo rje theg pa yang zhes pa ni yang gi sgras ni khri phrag bcu'i chad can no //
translated: Since it is an illustration, the Mahayana is ninety thousand.

original: lhag chad med par lan cig gis 'dzin par ga la nus zhes pa ni mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag chad med par lan cig gis 'dzin par ga la nus zhes pa ni mi nus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How can one possibly hold it all in mind at once without excess or deficiency? means it is impossible.

original: de bas na rdo rje 'chang chen po kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na rdo rje 'chang chen po kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only the Great Vajradhara.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zhes pa la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang zhes pa la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat also, etc. teaches the validity of scripture.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: 'jam dpal ni rgyal po chen po zas gtsang mang gyur to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'jam dpal ni rgyal po chen po zas gtsang mang gyur to zhes pa ni /
translated: Manjusri became the great king Shuddhodana.

original: zas gtsang ma ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yab ste rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: zas gtsang ma ni bcom ldan 'das kyi yab ste rgyu'i rdo rje 'chang ba'o //
translated: Shuddhodana is the Bhagavat's father, the causal Vajradhara.

original: 'jam dpal ni rgyal ba'i sras te sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: 'jam dpal ni rgyal ba'i sras te sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: Manjusri is the son of the Victor, an emanation body.

original: de dag tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: They are not different,

original: mdzad pa gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdzad pa gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the same deeds.üîΩMahesvara is the great goddess Maya,

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug ni lha mo chen mo sgyu 'phrul du gyur to zhes pa ni 'dis kyang bud med dang skyes pa dbyer med par sgyu ma lta bur mthong bas dngos po thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug ni lha mo chen mo sgyu 'phrul du gyur to zhes pa ni 'dis kyang bud med dang skyes pa dbyer med par sgyu ma lta bur mthong bas dngos po thams cad la gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid bstan to //
translated: this also shows that he sees women and men as undifferentiated, like an illusion, and thus teaches the characteristic of nonduality in all things.üîΩSri Devi is Yasodhara,

original: dpal lha mo ni grags 'dzin no zhes pa ni @107b bcom ldan 'das kyi btsun mo dam pa'o //
analyzed: dpal lha mo ni grags 'dzin no zhes pa ni @107b bcom ldan 'das kyi btsun mo dam pa'o //
translated: the Blessed One's chief queen.

original: de nyid dpal kyi lha mo ni rig bya rdo rje ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid dpal kyi lha mo ni rig bya rdo rje ma'o //
translated: She herself is Sri Devi, Vajra-graha.üîΩVajrasattva is Rahula,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni sgra gcan 'dzin no zhes pa ni sh'a kya seng ge'i sras te sprul pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni sgra gcan 'dzin no zhes pa ni sh'a kya seng ge'i sras te sprul pa'i sku'o //
translated: the son of Sakyamuni, an emanation body.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes de dag dbyer med pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o zhes de dag dbyer med pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Vajrasattva is the enjoyment body, thus they are taught to be inseparable.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood in all cases.

original: rigs pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la brtson pas nye bar sdud pa bstan to //
analyzed: rigs pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba la brtson pas nye bar sdud pa bstan to //
translated: This is the explanation of the word thus in the phrase thus have I heard.üîΩ Here,

original: 'dir / sangs rgyas mya ngan mi 'da' zhing //
analyzed: 'dir / sangs rgyas mya ngan mi 'da' zhing //
translated: the Buddha does not pass into nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje'i sku nyid kyis mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje'i sku nyid kyis mi zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the imperishability of the vajra body.

original: chos kyang nub par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: chos kyang nub par mi 'gyur te //
translated: And the Dharma does not set,

original: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis rlob pa de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis rlob pa de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the Buddha's blessing.

original: sems can rnams ni gdul bya'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni gdul bya'i phyir //
translated: For the sake of training sentient beings,

original: zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i sems can sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to engage future sentient beings.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yongs su mya ngan 'das pa dang nub pa yang nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yongs su mya ngan 'das pa dang nub pa yang nye bar bstan to //
translated: NirvƒÅ·πáa is taught as both complete nirvƒÅ·πáa and setting.

original: de ltar sdud pa po rnams dang dbyer med pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar sdud pa po rnams dang dbyer med pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown the inseparability of the compiler and the Buddha,

original: gleng gzhi'i tshig rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i tshig rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to fully teach the words of the introduction,

original: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says thus have I heard, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: By the Blessed One, and so on, he teaches the validity of the scriptures.

original: brgya byin gyis gsol pa ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: brgya byin gyis gsol pa ni dri ba'o //
translated: The question of Indra is questioning.

original: dri ba de nyid ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: dri ba de nyid ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: That very question is indicated by the words, Why is it so? and so forth.

original: 'dir ni skad kyi yi ge'i don gang yin pa dang ci'i slad du dang po sbyor ba dang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'am nyan thos kyis gsungs sam zhes 'dri ba'o //üîΩdam chos yon tan smra ba yi //
analyzed: 'dir ni skad kyi yi ge'i don gang yin pa dang ci'i slad du dang po sbyor ba dang sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'am nyan thos kyis gsungs sam zhes 'dri ba'o // dam chos yon tan smra ba yi //
translated: Here, it is the meaning of the words of the language, and why, and the application at the beginning, and whether it is spoken by the Buddha or spoken by the disciples that are asked about.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan gsungs so //
translated: The answer is given by the words beginning with The true Dharma is spoken by those who have the qualities of the Dharma, and so forth.

original: dri ba mchog yin pa'i phyir legs so zhes bya ba byin pa'o ;
analyzed: dri ba mchog yin pa'i phyir legs so zhes bya ba byin pa'o ;
translated: Because the question is supreme, Excellent! is given.

original: / gang phyir thams cad gzigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por sbyor ba'i dri ba'i lan no //
analyzed: / gang phyir thams cad gzigs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang por sbyor ba'i dri ba'i lan no //
translated: The answer to the question of application at the beginning is given by the words beginning with Because he sees all things, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir gyis ni don gang yin zhes dri ba'i lan no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gyis ni don gang yin zhes dri ba'i lan no //
translated: The answer to the question What is the meaning of 'because'? is given.

original: thams cad gzigs pa yis zhes pa 'dis nyan thos kyis gsungs pa bkag pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa yis zhes pa 'dis nyan thos kyis gsungs pa bkag pa'o //
translated: By the words by the one who sees all things, the speech of the disciples is excluded.

original: don de nyid las bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung yin zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de nyid las bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung yin zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That very meaning is indicated by the words the speech of the Sugata.

original: ji bzhin du zhes pa ni spyi'i don gyis bshad pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: ji bzhin du zhes pa ni spyi'i don gyis bshad pa'i rim pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it is‚Äù means according to the stage explained by the general meaning.

original: de ni go rims zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs so //üîΩchos kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs @108a * //
analyzed: de ni go rims zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog dang las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs so // chos kyi phung po zhes bya ba la sogs @108a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the sequence‚Äù is the side of the samƒÅdhi of the supreme Victor of the ma·πá·∏çala and the supreme Victor of action.

original: pas mdo sde la sogs pa chos kyi phung po thams cad du'o //
analyzed: pas mdo sde la sogs pa chos kyi phung po thams cad du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all the aggregates of Dharma‚Äù and so on refers to all the aggregates of Dharma, such as the s≈´tras.

original: pha dang ma'i ngo bo nyid yi ge gnyis yin zhes dam bca'o //
analyzed: pha dang ma'i ngo bo nyid yi ge gnyis yin zhes dam bca'o //
translated: The two syllables are the nature of father and mother.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir //üîΩyi ge ae ni mar gyur la //
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir // yi ge ae ni mar gyur la //
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: zhes smos te /
analyzed: zhes smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe syllable ai is the mother.‚Äù

original: ma ni shes rab ste ae'i rnam pa can chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgyas nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma ni shes rab ste ae'i rnam pa can chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgyas nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mother is wisdom, because it is characterized by the seal of the source of phenomena in the form of ai.

original: wa ni pha zhes bya bar grags //
analyzed: wa ni pha zhes bya bar grags //
translated: ‚ÄúThe syllable va is known as the father.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni thabs kyi ngo bo nyid rnal 'byor pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs kyi ngo bo nyid rnal 'byor pa yin te /
translated: The nature of the method is the yogin,

original: yi ge was nye bar mtshon pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge was nye bar mtshon pa'i rtags dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he possesses the sign characterized by the syllable va.

original: thig le de ni sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: thig le de ni sbyor ba ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThe drop is the union.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni dag 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dag 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the nature of the union of the pure essences.

original: des ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi 'brel ba'i ngo bo nyid ni bsnyen par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi 'brel ba'i ngo bo nyid ni bsnyen par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the nature of the relationship between the probandum and the probans is taught in the approach.

original: sbyor te shin tu rmad byung ba //
analyzed: sbyor te shin tu rmad byung ba //
translated: The connection is very wonderful.üîΩThis is because it completes the various moments of embracing, kissing, and so on.

original: zhes pa ni 'khyud pa dang tsum pa na la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes yan lag dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni 'khyud pa dang tsum pa na la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i skad cig ma rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes yan lag dang po'o //
translated: The first limb is complete.

original: ae ni padma zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ae ni padma zhes pa ni /
translated: E is the lotus.

original: gru gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gru gsum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is triangular.

original: wam ni rdo rje nyid yin no //
analyzed: wam ni rdo rje nyid yin no //
translated: Vam is the vajra.

original: zhes pa ni yi ge was gsang ba'i rdo rje mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge was gsang ba'i rdo rje mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the syllable vam indicates the secret vajra.

original: thig le der ni sa bon te //
analyzed: thig le der ni sa bon te //
translated: The seed is in the drop.

original: zhes pa ni de gnyis kyi dbus su gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de gnyis kyi dbus su gnas pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: This is the bodhicitta located in the middle of those two.

original: de las 'gro ba gsum po skyes //
analyzed: de las 'gro ba gsum po skyes //
translated: From that, the three migrations are born.

original: des ni rdo rje dang padma snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid nye bar sgrub pa zhes bya ba yan lag gnyis pa bstan to //

original: ae ni shes rab nyid gyur pa //
analyzed: ae ni shes rab nyid gyur pa //

original: zhes pa ni shes rab kyi padma'i lte bar char bkag par bya ba'i phyir yi ge phat rnam par bkod nas bskyod pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab po //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab kyi padma'i lte bar char bkag par bya ba'i phyir yi ge phat rnam par bkod nas bskyod pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab po //
translated: This is wisdom, which is the shaking that occurs when the syllable pha·π≠ is arranged in the center of the lotus of wisdom in order to block the rain.üîΩVa is the lord of supreme joy.

original: wa ni rab dga'i bdag po zhes pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i bdag po rdo rje la yi ge h'um bkod nas bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni bsgrub pa zhes bya ba yan lag gsum pa'o //

translated: This is the accomplishment, which is the third branch, the shaking that occurs when the syllable h≈´·πÉ is arranged on the vajra, the lord of supreme joy.

original: thig le ni myong ba'i ngang tshul can no //

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: de las yi ge de nyid kyang skyes zhes pa ni thig le de las badzra dhri ka ces bya ba la sogs pa'i @108b sa bon gyi sngags las skyes pa'i thugs rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa zhes sgrub pa chen po zhes bya ba yan lag bzhi

original: pa'o // chos kyi phyag rgya yi ge gnyis //
analyzed: pa'o // chos kyi phyag rgya yi ge gnyis //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos ni brgya khri bzhi stong gi tshad kyi phung po de la gang gis rgyas btab cing bsdus pa de ni chos kyi phyag rgya ste ae wam mo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la chos ni brgya khri bzhi stong gi tshad kyi phung po de la gang gis rgyas btab cing bsdus pa de ni chos kyi phyag rgya ste ae wam mo //
translated: Dharma means the aggregates which are measured as one hundred and forty thousand. That which is sealed and condensed by that is the Dharma seal, which is e-vam.

original: de bas na chos yang dag par brjod pa'i mdo las dge slong rnams de'i chos 'di skad bdag gis thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sdud par bya'o zhes gsungs so //

translated: Therefore, the Dharma-Udbhava Sutra says: ‚ÄúMonks, that Dharma should be condensed by this: ‚ÄòThus have I heard‚Äô and so forth.‚Äù

original: de bas na gsung rab thams cad kyi snying por gyur pa'i yi ge gnyis po yongs su shes pas sems can thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'gro ba gang gis yi ge gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

translated: Those beings who do not know the two syllables explained above, and who read, listen to, or contemplate the Dharma, are outside the Buddha's teachings, like the four sages who abandoned yoga.

original: yang na dgag par byed pa'i sgra spangs te /

analyzed: shes nas rtag tu 'don pa dag / ces pa ni 'dis yi ge gnyis po tsam yongs su shes pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi phyi rol tu 'gyur zhing sbyor ba spangs pa ni ting nge 'dzin spang pa yang thub pa bzhin zhes pa ni sh'akya seng
translated: And those who, knowing, always recite means that by knowing just these two syllables, one becomes an outsider to the Buddha's teachings, and abandons the practice, as in just as the Muni abandoned concentration.

original: ge dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ge dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
