analyzed: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid du byas nas slar yang rnam par spros te /
translated: Having made them the nature of the three beings, emanate them again.

original: sems can gyi don byas nas slar yang gshegs te shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su rnam par dgod cing dbang bskur ba dang phyag rgya gdab par bsams te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don byas nas slar yang gshegs te shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su rnam par dgod cing dbang bskur ba dang phyag rgya gdab par bsams te /
translated: After benefiting sentient beings, they return and are placed in the directions of east, and so on, and imagine that they are empowered and sealed.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa byas nas bya ba byas pa'i phyir rnam par zhu ba lha mo'i glus bskul bas bzhengs te /
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor dang bzlas pa byas nas bya ba byas pa'i phyir rnam par zhu ba lha mo'i glus bskul bas bzhengs te /
translated: After performing the subtle yoga and the recitation, they melt into the form of light in order to perform activities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pa gsan nas tshim par byed pa'i @110a * //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bstod pa gsan nas tshim par byed pa'i @110a * //
translated: The goddesses‚Äô songs arouse them, and they listen to the praises of the tathƒÅgatas and are satisfied.

original: cho ga la sogs pa rdzogs nas phyi'i dkyil 'khor lus kyi dkyil 'khor du bcug la /
analyzed: cho ga la sogs pa rdzogs nas phyi'i dkyil 'khor lus kyi dkyil 'khor du bcug la /
translated: After completing the rite of the outer ma·πá·∏çala, the ma·πá·∏çala is placed into the body ma·πá·∏çala.

original: yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur nas de yang yongs su gyur cing bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin thig le tsam du mthar thug la rdo rje 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gyi bdag nyid du gyur nas de yang yongs su gyur cing bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin thig le tsam du mthar thug la rdo rje 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: Having become the nature of the three syllables, that also transforms completely into a mere drop, the nature of great bliss, and finally becomes a vajra-holder.

original: spyi'i don zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: spyi'i don zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pas so zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The general meaning is by means of the creation stage, the rest of the sentence.

original: yang lung gis bshad pa zhes bya ba 'dis lung tshad ma las sbas pa'i don bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang lung gis bshad pa zhes bya ba 'dis lung tshad ma las sbas pa'i don bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, by this ‚Äúscriptural explanation,‚Äù the hidden meaning is to be explained from the valid scripture.

original: ae / ae ni shes rab dam pa ste //
analyzed: ae / ae ni shes rab dam pa ste //
translated: E is the supreme wisdom,

original: 'dod chags bral sogs skad cig bdag / srid pa gsum na yongs shes pa //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral sogs skad cig bdag / srid pa gsum na yongs shes pa //
translated: the nature of the moment free from passion, etc.

original: 'di ni rtsa bar rnam par bstan //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni rtsa bar rnam par bstan // zhes smos te /
translated: This is taught as the root.

original: 'dir dang po ye shes gsum po rnam par dpyad pa'i mtshan nyid can sbas pa'i don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dang po ye shes gsum po rnam par dpyad pa'i mtshan nyid can sbas pa'i don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first the hidden meaning of the three wisdoms, which have the characteristic of analysis, is to be explained.

original: sems rnam par dag par byed par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas dang po sngags sam phyag rgya'i rim pa la dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag par byed par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pas dang po sngags sam phyag rgya'i rim pa la dmigs par bya'o //
translated: The yogi/nƒ´ who wishes to purify the mind should first visualize the stage of mantra or the stage of mudrƒÅ.

original: de la sems ni rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: de la sems ni rnam gsum ste /
translated: The mind is threefold:

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: de nyid 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: It is the active consciousness, the afflicted mind, and the fundamental consciousness.

original: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur ba zla ba'i snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba'i ye shes skye bar gyur pa dang / 'dod chags bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnas gyur ba zla ba'i snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba'i ye shes skye bar gyur pa dang / 'dod chags bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The active consciousness, when it is transformed, gives rise to the light of the pristine wisdom of light, which is like the light of the moon, and it stops the thirty-three instincts of passionlessness, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pas nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'i ye shes skye ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rang bzhi bcu 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnas gyur pas nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba'i snang ba mched pa'i ye shes skye ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa rang bzhi bcu 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The afflicted mind, when it is transformed, gives rise to the light of the pristine wisdom of the spread of light, which is like the light of the sun, and it stops the forty instincts of passion, etc.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba dang / chags pa bar ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang bzhin bdun 'gog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa gnas gyur pas mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ba dang / chags pa bar ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang bzhin bdun 'gog par 'gyur ro //
translated: And the seven natures, beginning with the middling attachment, are stopped.

original: de yang gang gi tshe thams cad stong pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe thams cad stong pa la 'jug pa de'i tshe /
translated: And when one enters into the emptiness of all things,

original: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sprin med pa'i nam mkha' dang 'dra ba'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: the reality of the clear light, which is like a cloudless sky, is explained.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gsum po'i rnam grangs ni shes rab dang thabs dang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa gsum po'i rnam grangs ni shes rab dang thabs dang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the synonyms of the three consciousnesses are wisdom, means, and non-duality.

original: snang pa gsum ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: snang pa gsum ni gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: The three appearances are the side of the antidote.

original: stong pa la sogs pa gsum ni de rnam bar dag pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: stong pa la sogs pa gsum ni de rnam bar dag pa'i thabs so //
translated: The three emptinesses, etc., are the means of purifying them.

original: @110b 'bras bur gyur pa ni sems kyi 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: @110b 'bras bur gyur pa ni sems kyi 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The clear light of mind is the result.

original: la la'i skabs su mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ming gis gnyen po bstan pa dang / gnyen po'i ming gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / de'i thabs kyi ming gis kyang de dag bstan pa dang / de dag gi ming gis kyang de nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: la la'i skabs su mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ming gis gnyen po bstan pa dang / gnyen po'i ming gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs bstan pa dang / de'i thabs kyi ming gis kyang de dag bstan pa dang / de dag gi ming gis kyang de nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: In some cases, the antidotes are taught by the names of the discordant classes, the discordant classes are taught by the names of the antidotes, and they are taught by the names of their methods, and by their names.

original: dper na char gyis byas pa'i mu ge ni char med pas mu ge byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na char gyis byas pa'i mu ge ni char med pas mu ge byung zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, famine caused by rain is the famine that occurs due to lack of rain.

original: de la dang po shes rab kyi ye shes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dang po shes rab kyi ye shes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the wisdom of insight, first of all:

original: ae ni shes rab dam pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: ae ni shes rab dam pa zhes smos te /
translated: E is the supreme insight.

original: shes rab ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Insight is the engaging consciousness.

original: dbang po dang yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa'i rten cing 'brel pa tshogs pa las rab tu shes pa ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa'i rten cing 'brel pa tshogs pa las rab tu shes pa ste rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug go //
translated: It is the six collections of consciousness that arise from the assembly of the dependent origination of the sense faculties, objects, appearances, and attention.

original: 'dod chags bral sogs skad cig bdag / ces pa ni 'dod chags bral pa la sogs pa rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum gyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral sogs skad cig bdag / ces pa ni 'dod chags bral pa la sogs pa rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum gyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe nature of being free from attachment, and so on‚Äù refers to the nature of the thirty-three qualities such as being free from attachment.

original: srid pa gsum na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khams gsum na gnas pa'i gzugs rnam pa gsum la sogs pa yul dag tu'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khams gsum na gnas pa'i gzugs rnam pa gsum la sogs pa yul dag tu'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúin the three realms‚Äù refers to the three types of form that exist in the three realms, and so on.

original: yongs su shes pa ni yul gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni yul gzung ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The line ‚Äúthe nature of apprehending objects‚Äù refers to the nature of apprehending objects.

original: 'di ni rtsa bar zhes pa la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rtsa bar zhes pa la mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúthis is the root‚Äù refers to the eye consciousness and so on.

original: gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir khams ni 'od ma 'greng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: gnyis pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir khams ni 'od ma 'greng ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to teach the second, he says ‚Äúthe elements are like an upright bamboo,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnyis pa ste bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid gnyis pa ste bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness is the second, afflicted mind, because it is associated with the four such as the view of self.

original: wam / 'od ma 'greng ba ltar zhes pa ni dper na khong stong 'od ma yin yang tshigs mdud kyi dbang gis bstan pa nyid du gyur ro //
analyzed: wam / 'od ma 'greng ba ltar zhes pa ni dper na khong stong 'od ma yin yang tshigs mdud kyi dbang gis bstan pa nyid du gyur ro //
translated: The line ‚Äúlike an upright bamboo‚Äù means that although the hollow interior is not the bamboo, it is taught to be the bamboo because of the joints.

original: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin yang shes pa de nyid nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa bzhi'i dbang gis bstan par snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis stong pa yin yang shes pa de nyid nyon mongs pa'i mdud pa bzhi'i dbang gis bstan par snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, although it is empty of intrinsic nature, that cognition itself appears to be taught by the power of the four knots of affliction.

original: sems las byung ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems las byung ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the mental factors,

original: 'dod chags la sogs rab skye ldan //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs rab skye ldan //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúendowed with the arising of desire and so on.‚Äù

original: zhes pa ni thabs kyi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin bzhi bcu'i skad cig ma la sogs pa'i dbye bas skye ba gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni thabs kyi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin bzhi bcu'i skad cig ma la sogs pa'i dbye bas skye ba gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which is endowed with the arising of the method‚Äôs intrinsic nature, the forty moments of the nature, and so on, is the method.

original: de bzhin du gnyen po'i ming gis snang ba mched pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyen po'i ming gis snang ba mched pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Likewise, the appearance of the antidote is called ‚Äúarisen.‚Äù

original: de 'gog pas de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'gog pas de dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is observed by stopping that.

original: de nyid thabs zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i grong khyer sna tshogs pa sprul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩming zhes pa ni de nyid @111a * //
analyzed: de nyid thabs zhes pa ni 'khor ba'i grong khyer sna tshogs pa sprul pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // ming zhes pa ni de nyid @111a * //
translated: That itself is the method because it is the cause of emanating the various cities of samsara.

original: kyi brda ru shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi brda ru shes par bya'o //
translated: Name is understood to be the symbol of that.

original: gsum pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the third,

original: ma / rig chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma / rig chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúmahƒÅvidyƒÅ,‚Äù and so on.

original: rig chen ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo ste 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rig chen ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo ste 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The great principle is the essence of the dharmadhƒÅtu, which is clear light.üîΩWhy is that?

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: It is said:

original: ma rig pa ni zla ba yi //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni zla ba yi // zhes smos te /
translated: Ignorance is the moon.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bdun dang bcas par 'gog par byed pas so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa rang bzhin bdun dang bcas par 'gog par byed pas so //
translated: Because it causes the cessation of the foundation consciousness together with its seven accompanying consciousnesses.

original: ma rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the foundation consciousness.

original: 'di 'byung ba zhes pa ni de spangs pas de bas snang ba 'byung ba ni mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba thob pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di 'byung ba zhes pa ni de spangs pas de bas snang ba 'byung ba ni mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba thob pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising of this is the arising of the appearance of clear light, which is like the appearance at dawn.

original: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas gnyen po'i sgo nas 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsum gyi mtshan nyid bstan nas gnyen po'i sgo nas 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Having explained the characteristics of the three consciousnesses, in order to explain the entry into clear light by way of the antidote, it says:

original: y'a / gang yang rnam shes dang po ste //üîΩzhes smos te /
analyzed: y'a / gang yang rnam shes dang po ste // zhes smos te /
translated: The first consciousness is

original: dang po'i rnam par shes pa ni sngags sam phyag rgya'i rim pas sbyangs pa na /
analyzed: dang po'i rnam par shes pa ni sngags sam phyag rgya'i rim pas sbyangs pa na /
translated: When the first consciousness is purified by the stage of mantra or mudrƒÅ,

original: snang ba mched pa'i ming ni ye shes gnyis pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: snang ba mched pa'i ming ni ye shes gnyis pa nyid du 'gyur ro ;
translated: the name of the appearance of increase becomes the second exalted wisdom.

original: / de ni snang ba mched pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: / de ni snang ba mched pa dag pa'o //
translated: That is the purification of the light of appearance.

original: de ni stong pa cher 'gyur la //
analyzed: de ni stong pa cher 'gyur la //
translated: That becomes the great emptiness.

original: zhes pa ni mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba thob pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtshams kyi snang ba dang 'dra ba'i snang ba thob pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the attainment of the wisdom that has the nature of the light that is like the light of the intermediate state.

original: de ni stong pa chen po'i ngo bo nyid snang ba mched pa'i ye shes dag par 'gyur bas 'od gsal ba ni thams cad stong pa 'od gsal bar 'gro ba ni 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni stong pa chen po'i ngo bo nyid snang ba mched pa'i ye shes dag par 'gyur bas 'od gsal ba ni thams cad stong pa 'od gsal bar 'gro ba ni 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since that becomes the purification of the wisdom of the light of appearance that has the nature of the great emptiness, the clear light goes to the clear light of the emptiness of everything.

original: dgongs pa 'dis rab tu byed mkhan gyis kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: dgongs pa 'dis rab tu byed mkhan gyis kyang gsungs te /
translated: This is the intention of the author of the commentary, who says:üîΩEmptiness, great emptiness,üîΩthe third is the great emptiness,

original: stong nyid shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //
analyzed: stong nyid shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ni //
translated: and the fourth is the emptiness of everything.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go ;
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag go ;
translated: This is the distinction of cause and effect.üîΩThe light, the light of appearance,

original: / snang ba snang ba mched pa dang // de bzhin snang ba nyer thob pa //
analyzed: / snang ba snang ba mched pa dang // de bzhin snang ba nyer thob pa //
translated: and likewise the light of attainment,

original: sems ni rnam pa gsum bstan pa //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gsum bstan pa //
translated: are taught to be the three aspects of mind.

original: de yi bsgrub pa bshad par bya //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yi bsgrub pa bshad par bya //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Their accomplishment will be explained.

original: bsdu ba bstan nas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba bstan nas bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to demonstrate the collection and to generate.

original: shru / snang ba gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: shru / snang ba gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The three appearances, etc.

original: sngon du bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum po gang yin pa de snang ba gsum gyi mtshan nyid can de 'gog pas snang ba la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bshad pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum po gang yin pa de snang ba gsum gyi mtshan nyid can de 'gog pas snang ba la sogs pa'i sgras brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The three consciousnesses that were previously explained have the characteristic of the three appearances. By stopping them, they are to be expressed by the words appearance, etc.

original: sems can khams ni ma lus pa'i //
analyzed: sems can khams ni ma lus pa'i //
translated: The entire realm of sentient beings

original: zhes pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can gyi khams kyi'o //
translated: refers to the realm of sentient beings who experience the three realms.

original: @111b rang bzhin rtsa ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: @111b rang bzhin rtsa ba 'di yin no //
translated: This is the root nature.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa brgya drug cu rnams kyi rtsa ba ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs dang ma rig pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa brgya drug cu rnams kyi rtsa ba ste rgyu'o //
translated: This is the root, the cause, of the one hundred and sixty attachments, etc., which have the nature of wisdom, method, and ignorance.

original: de rnams rnam par shes pa gsum las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams rnam par shes pa gsum las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from the three consciousnesses.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
analyzed: len pa'i rnam par shes pa zab cing phra //
translated: The appropriating consciousness is profound and subtle,

original: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
analyzed: sa bon thams cad chu bo'i rgyun bzhin 'bab //
translated: With all seeds flowing like a river.

original: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
analyzed: bdag tu rtog par gyur na mi rung zhes //
translated: It is not proper to think of it as a self,

original: nyan thos byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
analyzed: nyan thos byis pa rnams la ngas ma bstan //
translated: so I have not taught it to the childish disciples.

original: zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du yang /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du yang /
translated: And similarly,

original: yang dag ma yin kun brtags ni //üîΩsems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun brtags ni // sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: de ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa yang dag par sbyor bas 'gro ba rnams kyi skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rlung dang rnam par shes pa yang dag par sbyor bas 'gro ba rnams kyi skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the birth of beings by the union of wind and consciousness,üîΩhe says,

original: tam / da ni re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tam / da ni re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, each of the winds and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas /
translated: Through the doors of the sense faculties such as the eyes,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'i don gang dang gang snang pa de dang de dag rlung gis kho na yang dag par blangs nas 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'am bde ba la sogs pa'i don gang dang gang snang pa de dang de dag rlung gis kho na yang dag par blangs nas 'dzin par byed de /
translated: whatever objects such as blue or happiness and so on appear, those very objects are taken up and grasped by the winds alone,

original: g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i ngo bo de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo 'gul la sogs pa'i ngo bo de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the nature of movement and so on.

original: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But not by consciousness,

original: g-yo 'gul la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo 'gul la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it lacks movement and so on.

original: de bas na 'phye bo dang long ba bzhin du //
analyzed: de bas na 'phye bo dang long ba bzhin du //
translated: Therefore, like a cripple and a blind man,

original: rlung dang ldan pa'i rnam shes ni /
analyzed: rlung dang ldan pa'i rnam shes ni /
translated: the consciousness endowed with wind

original: rtag tu 'gro la gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu 'gro la gnas par 'gyur //
translated: always goes and stays.

original: zhes bya ba 'di srid pa gsum gyi bar du yang 'gro ba dang 'ong zhing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di srid pa gsum gyi bar du yang 'gro ba dang 'ong zhing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: This [consciousness] goes and comes, and enters [the womb] until the three existences.

original: las kyi lus kyi skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: las kyi lus kyi skye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach the birth of the body of karma,

original: ae / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ae / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, E! This... and so on.

original: 'chi ba'i srid pa 'das nas zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bar du bar ma do'i srid pa nam mkha' la gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i srid pa 'das nas zhag nyi shu rtsa gcig gi bar du bar ma do'i srid pa nam mkha' la gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: After passing through the existence of death, the intermediate existence abides in the sky for twenty-one days.

original: rang gi gnyen dang gnas la sogs pa dang bdag gi lus 'di yin zhes yongs su ngo shes shing gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi gnyen dang gnas la sogs pa dang bdag gi lus 'di yin zhes yongs su ngo shes shing gnas so //
translated: It recognizes its own relatives, dwelling places, and so on, and thinks, This is my body.

original: de bas na las kyi rlung gis bskul bas pha ma'i g-yem pa'i dus su zhe sdang dang bcas pa'am 'dod chags dang bcas par skye gnas su 'jug cing lus len par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na las kyi rlung gis bskul bas pha ma'i g-yem pa'i dus su zhe sdang dang bcas pa'am 'dod chags dang bcas par skye gnas su 'jug cing lus len par byed do //
translated: Therefore, impelled by the wind of karma, with anger or desire at the time of the parents' copulation, it enters the womb and takes on a body.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ni bzhi pa ste skul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa gsum gyi ni bzhi pa ste skul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the fourth, which is the instigator, is of the three consciousnesses.

original: de yis rang bzhin rtag tu ni //
analyzed: de yis rang bzhin rtag tu ni //
translated: By that, the natures are always

original: ji lta ji ltar nges par 'byung //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar nges par 'byung //
translated: as they are, according to the emergence.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa rnams las /üîΩsems @112a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par shes pa rnams las / sems @112a * //
translated: This is from the consciousnesses.

original: las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin rnams skad cig la sogs pa'i dus kyi dbye ba dang / yul gyi snang ba yod pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'dod chags bral ba la sogs pa rang bzhin rnams skad cig la sogs pa'i dus kyi dbye ba dang / yul gyi snang ba yod pa las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The natures, such as freedom from attachment, which are the entities of mental factors, arise from the division of time, such as a moment, and from the appearance of an object.

original: mngal nas 'byung ba'i ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngal nas 'byung ba'i ngo bo bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of emergence from the womb,

original: ka / sra ba'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ka / sra ba'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe element of solidity,‚Äù and so on.

original: rlung nyid kyis 'byung ba chen po bzhi blangs te /
analyzed: rlung nyid kyis 'byung ba chen po bzhi blangs te /
translated: The wind itself takes up the four great elements

original: lus can rnams khams gsum du 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: lus can rnams khams gsum du 'khor bar byed do //
translated: and causes embodied beings to cycle in the three realms.

original: phung po 'byung ba bstan par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po 'byung ba bstan par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the arising of the aggregates,üîΩhe says,

original: smin / 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'dis de lta bu'i lus po gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smin / 'di na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa 'dis de lta bu'i lus po gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'i bdag nyid du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This body, etc.

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ni de dag rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung gi rang dbang du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ni de dag rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung gi rang dbang du ni ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of the conditioned are that they arise in dependence, not independently.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po las ni dngos mi skye //
analyzed: dngos po las ni dngos mi skye //
translated: A thing does not arise from a thing,

original: dngos med las kyang 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: dngos med las kyang 'byung ba yin //
translated: Nor does it arise from a non-thing.

original: dngos po rtag tu skye ba ni //
analyzed: dngos po rtag tu skye ba ni //
translated: The arising of a thing is always

original: 'khrul pas mkha' yi me tog bzhin //
analyzed: 'khrul pas mkha' yi me tog bzhin //
translated: Like a sky-flower.

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from another,

original: gnyi ga las min rgyu med min //üîΩdngos po gang dang gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyi ga las min rgyu med min // dngos po gang dang gang na yang //
translated: Not from both, not without cause,üîΩIn no place, in no way,

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Is there ever any arising.

original: de bas na 'khrul pa tsam gyi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga zhes tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa tsam gyi ngo bo gzugs la sogs pa phung po lnga zhes tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the five aggregates of form, etc., are said to be of the nature of mere error.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam 'grel las kyang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi rnam 'grel las kyang /
translated: In the Bodhicittavivara·πáa it is said:

original: gzugs ni lbu ba lta bu ste //
analyzed: gzugs ni lbu ba lta bu ste //
translated: Form is like a bubble,

original: tshor ba chu bur lta bu yin //
analyzed: tshor ba chu bur lta bu yin //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble.

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage.

original: 'du byed chu shing dang 'dra zhing //
analyzed: 'du byed chu shing dang 'dra zhing //
translated: Conditioning is like a plantain tree.

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu ste //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu ste //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: phung po'i bstan pa 'di yin no //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phung po'i bstan pa 'di yin no // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the teaching on the aggregates.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs bstan nas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs bstan nas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the side of affliction, in order to teach the side of purification,

original: sa / mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa / mnyam nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúequality,‚Äù and so on.

original: phung po lnga gnas gyur pas ye shes lnga thob pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum kho na rgyu yin no //
analyzed: phung po lnga gnas gyur pas ye shes lnga thob pa'i rnam par shes pa gsum kho na rgyu yin no //
translated: The three consciousnesses alone are the cause of attaining the five gnoses through the transformation of the five aggregates.

original: de med pas phung po yang med do //
analyzed: de med pas phung po yang med do //
translated: Since they do not exist, the aggregates do not exist.

original: ci'i rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ye shes skye'o //
analyzed: ci'i rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir ye shes skye'o //
translated: For what purpose does gnosis arise? For the sake of purification.

original: skye mched kyi bskyed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skye mched kyi bskyed pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the generation of the sense bases,

original: ma / yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma / yid kyi skye mched ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe sense base of mind,‚Äù and so on.

original: yid la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug ste /
analyzed: yid la sogs pa nang gi skye mched drug ste /
translated: The six inner sense bases are the mind and so on.

original: gang gis las kyi lus po 'di dang yul rnams dang len par byed de /
analyzed: gang gis las kyi lus po 'di dang yul rnams dang len par byed de /
translated: By what does this body of karma and the objects come to be appropriated?

original: 'dir ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dor te bshad par bya ba @112b yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni tshigs su bcad pa gcig 'dor te bshad par bya ba @112b yin no //
translated: Here one verse is omitted and the explanation is to be done.

original: lus skyes pas las kyi dbang gis skye ba len pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus skyes pas las kyi dbang gis skye ba len pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the appropriation of birth by the power of karma through the arising of the body,

original: bha / 'byung ba 'di las rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas nas de nas shi 'phos te ngan song dang bde 'gro la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can skye ba thob pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa
analyzed: bha / 'byung ba 'di las rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin brgya drug cu'i dbang gis dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas nas de nas shi 'phos te ngan song dang bde 'gro la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can skye ba thob pa gang yin pa de'i rgyu ni rnam par shes pa
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúFrom these elements, the nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: gsum po kho na las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum po kho na las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: Through the power of the nature of the one hundred and sixty afflictions, such as desire, having performed virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, then, having died and transmigrated, whatever birth is obtained, characterized by the lower realms and happy realms, the cause of that is not other than the three consciousnesses alone.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa phung po rnam par dag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa phung po rnam par dag pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the stage of generation and the purification of the aggregates,

original: ga / 'gro bar byed ces ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ga / 'gro bar byed ces ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúThe one who goes,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'gro ba ni mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBeings‚Äù are humans and so forth.

original: des na bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag 'byung ba ni skye bar 'gyur te nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rten cing 'brel pa yan
analyzed: des na bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dag tu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag 'byung ba ni skye bar 'gyur te nyon mongs pa dang las dang rnam par smin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rten cing 'brel pa yan
translated: Thus, the five aggregates appropriated in the good and bad destinies, which are form and so forth, arise, that is, come into being, through the twelve members of dependent origination, which have the nature of afflictions, actions, and their results.

original: lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can srid pa'i 'khor los yongs su 'khor ro //
analyzed: lag bcu gnyis kyi mtshan nyid can srid pa'i 'khor los yongs su 'khor ro //
translated: They are completely turned by the wheel of existence.

original: de dag dag par bya ba'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i bsgom pas sangs rgyas lnga'i ngo bo nyid thob pa gang yin pa de'i yang rgyu ni rnam par shes pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de dag dag par bya ba'i phyir bskyed pa'i rim pa mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga'i bsgom pas sangs rgyas lnga'i ngo bo nyid thob pa gang yin pa de'i yang rgyu ni rnam par shes pa gsum yin no //
translated: For the sake of purifying those, the cause of the attainment of the nature of the five buddhas is the three consciousnesses, which is the meditation on the creation stage and the five manifest enlightenments.

original: sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of the purification of earth and so forth,

original: w'ana / rlung dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: w'ana / rlung dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares ‚Äúwind‚Äù and so forth.

original: sa la sogs pa khams bzhi po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo spyan ma la sogs kyi btsun mo yang rnam par shes pa gsum po las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa khams bzhi po rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo spyan ma la sogs kyi btsun mo yang rnam par shes pa gsum po las 'byung ba ste /
translated: The queens such as Lochana, who are the essence of the four elements such as earth, arise from the three consciousnesses.

original: de la dmigs pa las de dag rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de la dmigs pa las de dag rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because they are purified from the objective supports of those [elements].

original: de bas na sangs rgyas byang chub ni zhes smos te sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' las sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa de nyid ces tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas byang chub ni zhes smos te sa brgyad pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' las sangs rgyas nyid ster bar byed pa de nyid ces tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe enlightenment of the Buddha,‚Äù which is the bestowal of Buddhahood from the Bodhisattva who is on the eighth stage.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause of the purification of the eye, etc.,

original: sa / thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sa / thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúall‚Äù and so forth.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gang slar bshad pa de nyid rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyun can yin no //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gang slar bshad pa de nyid rnam par shes pa gsum gyi rgyun can yin no //
translated: That which is explained by all the Tathagatas by means of the creation stage is the stream of the three consciousnesses.

original: phyag rgya bzhis ni rgyas btab cing //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhis ni rgyas btab cing //
translated: Sealed with the four seals,

original: zhes pa ni de las dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bsdu ba'i mtshan @113a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de las dgug pa dang / gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bsdu ba'i mtshan @113a * //
translated: This is the summoning, the entering, the binding, and the controlling.üîΩ

original: nyid can phyag rgya bzhi po'o //
analyzed: nyid can phyag rgya bzhi po'o //
translated: These are the four seals, which have the nature of summoning, entering, binding, and controlling the gnosis being.

original: gang gis ye shes sems dpa' dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis ye shes sems dpa' dgug pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: By means of these, one should summon the gnosis being and so forth.

original: yang na spyan la sogs pa bzhi po ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na spyan la sogs pa bzhi po ni phyag rgya bzhi ste /
translated: Or else, the four such as LocanƒÅ are the four seals,

original: de rnams kyis rgyas btab pa ni yongs su bskor te des ni gsang ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor chen po bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis rgyas btab pa ni yongs su bskor te des ni gsang ba lnga'i dkyil 'khor chen po bstan to //
translated: and the one who is sealed by them is surrounded by them.

analyzed: yang na las dang ; chos dang / dam tshig dang / phyag rgya chen po'i dam tshig can bzhi'o //
translated: Or else, they are the four who possess the commitments of action, Dharma, pledge, and great seal.

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs de dag gis 'grub par bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish the form of the great seal by means of those.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'jigs byed ces bya ba rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud las /

analyzed: de nas de dag rnams kyis ni //

analyzed: rnal 'byor gsang ba mchog bshad bya //

original: dang po ye shes sems bsgoms nas //
analyzed: dang po ye shes sems bsgoms nas //

analyzed: phyag rgya chen po 'chang bar bya // zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang mtshungs pa'i //

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i mthong ba bzhin //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i mthong ba bzhin //
translated: As seen in the great yoga,

original: rtag tu las kyi rgya bcings te //
analyzed: rtag tu las kyi rgya bcings te //
translated: Always binding the karma mudra,

original: sna tshogs rdo rje snying gar gnas //üîΩnges pa nyid du shes byas na //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rje snying gar gnas // nges pa nyid du shes byas na //
translated: The vajra cross is located at the heart.üîΩHaving ascertained it,

analyzed: de tshe the tshom med par 'grub //
translated: One will definitely succeed without doubt.

original: dang po rdo rje lcer bsgoms te //
analyzed: dang po rdo rje lcer bsgoms te //

analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya yang dag 'chang //

original: ci 'dod pa yi las rnams ni //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa yi las rnams ni //
translated: Whatever actions one desires

original: myur du the tshom med par 'grub //
analyzed: myur du the tshom med par 'grub //
translated: Will be quickly accomplished without doubt.üîΩThus, if the wise one does not know

original: de ltar phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: de ltar phyag rgya rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The four kinds of mudras,

original: blo ldan gang gis mi shes na //
analyzed: blo ldan gang gis mi shes na //

analyzed: sdom pa'i rnal 'byor mchog nyid ni // de yis nges par thob mi 'gyur //
translated: The supreme yoga of the commitments.

original: dkon zhing bde ba'i thabs 'di ni /
analyzed: dkon zhing bde ba'i thabs 'di ni /
translated: This method of the rare and blissful

original: sangs rgyas rol ston gsang ba yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rol ston gsang ba yin //
translated: The Buddha's play is secret.

original: de ni byang chub sems yin te //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems yin te //
translated: That is the Thought of Enlightenment,

original: rtag tu shes rab rgya mtshor gnas //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu shes rab rgya mtshor gnas // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: always abiding in the ocean of wisdom.

original: mig la sogs pa'i bdag nyid der //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i bdag nyid der //
translated: The there is the nature of the eye, etc.

original: zhes pa ni lus de nyid du mig la sogs pa gang yod pa de dag tu shin tu rnal 'byor gyi rim pas sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyi sa bon bkod pas rnam par dag par byed pa gang yin pa de ni
analyzed: zhes pa ni lus de nyid du mig la sogs pa gang yod pa de dag tu shin tu rnal 'byor gyi rim pas sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' brgyad kyi sa bon bkod pas rnam par dag par byed pa gang yin pa de ni
translated: That is, in that very body, wherever the eye, etc. are, by the process of the highest yoga, one places the seeds of the eight Bodhisattvas, Kshitigarbha, etc. and purifies them.

original: shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can kho na'o //
translated: That is the cause of the three knowledges alone.

original: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i yan lag la 'god pa ni shes pa gsum gyi yang rgyu can yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i yan lag la 'god pa ni shes pa gsum gyi yang rgyu can yin par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the establishment of the branches of the yoga of imagination is also the cause of the three knowledges,üîΩhe says,

original: rba / rol pas shes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rba / rol pas shes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the play of the three knowledges, etc.

original: phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i khro bo'i @113b rgyal po'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor du brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs skyong rnams zil gyis mnan nas bzhugs pa /
analyzed: phyogs bcu na gnas pa'i khro bo'i @113b rgyal po'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor du brgya byin la sogs pa phyogs skyong rnams zil gyis mnan nas bzhugs pa /
translated: The wrathful kings who reside in the ten directions, having overpowered Indra and so forth, the guardians of the directions, in the outer mandala,

analyzed: stobs dang mthu che ba gang yin pa de rnams zhal la sogs pa'i yan lag dang nying lag rnams su rnam par bkod pa /

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bzhugs pa gang yin pa de yang shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bzhugs pa gang yin pa de yang shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can yin no //
translated: That which exists in the manner of the mandala of the body is also the cause of the three knowledges.

original: de'i rjes su dkyil 'khor nye bar sdud pa la rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi sgom pa'i yang rgyu shes pa gsum yin pa zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dkyil 'khor nye bar sdud pa la rang bzhin med pa nyid kyi sgom pa'i yang rgyu shes pa gsum yin pa zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: After that, in order to teach that the cause of the meditation on the absence of intrinsic reality in the dissolution of the mandala is also the three knowledges,

original: ta / de dang de yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ta / de dang de yi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat and that,‚Äù and so forth.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rigs las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rigs las 'byung ba ste /
translated: They arise from the family of the mind vajra holder and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams so //
translated: They are the tathƒÅgatas, goddesses, bodhisattvas, and wrathful ones.

original: de dag kho na yod min zhes pa ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar nye bar bsdus pas dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kho na yod min zhes pa ni las kyi rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar nye bar bsdus pas dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey do not exist at all‚Äù means that they are not objects of meditation, because they are withdrawn at the end of the samƒÅdhi of the supreme victor of action.

original: 'on kyang 'gro ba'i don du bstan pa yin zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa'i sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gro ba'i don du bstan pa yin zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa'i sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúHowever, they are taught for the benefit of the world‚Äù means that in order to care for the realm of sentient beings disturbed by the afflictions of passion and so on,

original: de dang de'i mos pas dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa yin kyi /
analyzed: de dang de'i mos pas dbye bas bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa yin kyi /
translated: the emanations of the BhagavƒÅn are differentiated by their various interests.

original: don dam par de dag thams cad 'od gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don dam par de dag thams cad 'od gsal ba nyid do //
translated: However, ultimately, all of them are clear light.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas so sor sdud pa'i yan lag gis 'jug pa ni shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas so sor sdud pa'i yan lag gis 'jug pa ni shes pa gsum gyi rgyu can yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the yogi/nƒ´ of the stage of completion who engages in the branch of withdrawal is endowed with the three knowledges,

original: th'a / 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: th'a / 'di las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares ‚Äúfrom this‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa'i dus su dman pa dang bar ma dang dam pa'i dbye bas so so tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga mchog tu gyur par rnam par 'jog cing shes pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin zhes rnam par
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod pa'i dus su dman pa dang bar ma dang dam pa'i dbye bas so so tha dad pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga mchog tu gyur par rnam par 'jog cing shes pa gsum gyi ngo bo nyid yin zhes rnam par
translated: When enjoying the five sense objects, the five objects such as form are posited as supreme, differentiated by the categories of inferior, middling, and excellent, and one should understand them to be the nature of the three consciousnesses.

analyzed: spyod cing / yul dang dbang po bcu po gnyis su med par mthong nas /
translated: Having seen the nonduality of the ten objects and faculties,

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bor lhag par mos te /
translated: one should imagine them to be the essence of the tathƒÅgatas such as Vairocana.

original: rnal 'byor pas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas gnas par bya'o //
translated: The yogƒ´ should abide in that.

original: so sor sdud pa dag par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi yan lag gis 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes gsum gyi rgyu can no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor sdud pa dag par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi yan lag gis 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni ye shes gsum gyi rgyu can no zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the engagement by the branches of concentration for the sake of purifying withdrawal is due to the cause of the three intuitions,

original: ga / dbang po rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ga / dbang po rang nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe five faculties themselves,‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang po lnga po ni rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa @114a * //
analyzed: dbang po lnga po ni rang rang gi yul 'dzin pa @114a * //
translated: The five faculties apprehend their own objects.

original: la sred pa can yin pas gang gi tshe de rnams gzung bar byed na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis snang bas spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: la sred pa can yin pas gang gi tshe de rnams gzung bar byed na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyis snang bas spyod par bya'o //
translated: Since they are desirous, when they are to be apprehended, then at that time, by the appearance of the nature of the TathƒÅgatas, which is the nature of the five gnoses, one should engage in conduct.

original: don de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that meaning extensively, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: ta / dbang po de de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ta / dbang po de de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúta,‚Äù and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas rang rang gi yul thob cing /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i sgo nas rang rang gi yul thob cing /
translated: Through the doors of the sense organs such as the eyes, one obtains one‚Äôs own object,üîΩand through the joy that arises from that and that, one should satisfy all the tathƒÅgatas.

original: de dang de las 'byung ba'i dga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tshim par bgyid do zhes lhag par mos pas shes pa gsum kho na'i rnam 'phrul yin te /
analyzed: de dang de las 'byung ba'i dga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad tshim par bgyid do zhes lhag par mos pas shes pa gsum kho na'i rnam 'phrul yin te /
translated: Since one has superior devotion, [this is] the magical display of just the three consciousnesses,

analyzed: bde ba'i rang bzhin rnam par shes pa gsum las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //

original: shes pa gsum brtag pa nye bar sdud pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa gsum brtag pa nye bar sdud pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of the examination of the three consciousnesses, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: k'a / sku gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: k'a / sku gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúkƒÅya,‚Äù and so on.

original: dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rim pa'am bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: dang po'i sbyor ba la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi rim pa'am bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pas /
translated: By the sequence of the three samadhis, such as the initial union, or by the sequence of the self-consecration,

analyzed: chos dang longs spyod dang sprul pa'i bdag nyid sku gsum po bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gsungs pa /
translated: the three bodies of the Bhagavat, which are the nature of the Dharma, Enjoyment, and Emanation Bodies,

analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of the completion stage,

original: gcig tu yang ni 'gyur ba yin /üîΩzhes pa la ;
analyzed: gcig tu yang ni 'gyur ba yin / zhes pa la ;

original: ye shes gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas /
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi rnam par rtog pa spangs pas /

analyzed: 'od gsal ba shar bar gyur pas ro gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the arising of the clear light is the meaning of ‚Äúthey become one.‚Äù

analyzed: de yan chad ye shes gsum po rnam par dpyod pa'i mtshan nyid can sbas pa'i don rnam pa gcig tu bstan to //

original: ye / gang yang khams gsum sems can rnams //
analyzed: ye / gang yang khams gsum sems can rnams //
translated: Now, the three realms of sentient beings

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngon du bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad par bya ste /

original: sgo nga las skyes pa dang mngal nas skyes pa dang drod gsher las skyes pa dang rdzus te skyes pa'i dbye bas khams gsum gyi sems can ji srid yod pa de srid thams cad bsam gtan dang klog pa'i ting nge 'dzin pa dang kha na ma tho ba
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa dang mngal nas skyes pa dang drod gsher las skyes pa dang rdzus te skyes pa'i dbye bas khams gsum gyi sems can ji srid yod pa de srid thams cad bsam gtan dang klog pa'i ting nge 'dzin pa dang kha na ma tho ba
translated: As long as there are sentient beings in the three realms, they are born from eggs, born from wombs, born from heat and moisture, and born miraculously.

original: med cing mi shes pas kyang rdo rje'i bzlas pas gsang sngags kyi rgyal po rang bzhin gyis bzlas par byed de /
analyzed: med cing mi shes pas kyang rdo rje'i bzlas pas gsang sngags kyi rgyal po rang bzhin gyis bzlas par byed de /
translated: They are without sin and without ignorance, and they recite the king of secret mantra through vajra repetition, naturally reciting the essence mantra.

original: srog dang rtsol ba de'i ngo bor zlos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir pha ma mnyam par sbyor ba'i dus su 'jug pas sogs @114b * //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba de'i ngo bor zlos pa'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir pha ma mnyam par sbyor ba'i dus su 'jug pas sogs @114b * //

original: pa'i rlung gsum gyi bdag nyid nye bar sdud pas sems can de rnams skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i rlung gsum gyi bdag nyid nye bar sdud pas sems can de rnams skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of the union of the parents, the three winds of entry and so forth gather, and sentient beings are born.

original: nyin dang mtshan du stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang drug brgya'i rlung rnams rgyu ba ste zo chun bzhin no //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan du stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig dang drug brgya'i rlung rnams rgyu ba ste zo chun bzhin no //

original: 'dis ni 'dod chags kyi chos rab tu bstan pas sbas pa'i don gnyis pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'dod chags kyi chos rab tu bstan pas sbas pa'i don gnyis pa bshad do //
translated: This explains the second hidden meaning, which is the teaching of the Dharma of passion.

original: da ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtags par byed pa'i mtshan nyid bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtags par byed pa'i mtshan nyid bdag la byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: ya / gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ya / gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúO, the one who sees the body of the buddhas as a rainbow,‚Äù and so on.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ste rnam pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku ste rnam pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúbody of the buddhas‚Äù is the form of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: de 'ja' tshon bzhin du gang gis mthong ba de mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de 'ja' tshon bzhin du gang gis mthong ba de mtshan nyid do //
translated: The one who sees that as a rainbow sees its characteristic.

original: kun rdzob ces pa ni myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bzhengs pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces pa ni myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis bzhengs pa'i ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConventional‚Äù is the gnosis body that arises through the samƒÅdhi of speed.

analyzed: de'i bden pa ni sgyu ma bcu gnyis kyi dpe dang 'dra bar mthong ba'o //
translated: Its ‚Äútruth‚Äù is seeing it as similar to the example of the twelve illusions.

original: de nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bshad pa yin te /

original: 'od gsal ba rnam par dag pas so zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las myur du yang dag par byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba rnam par dag pas so zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob pa'i 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las myur du yang dag par byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the purity of clear light means that it quickly arises from the reality of clear light attained by the stage of the pure mind.

analyzed: w'aka / tshig gi lam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe path of speech,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin ye shes sku //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin ye shes sku //
translated: This is the wisdom body by nature,

original: ngag gi lam gyi spyod yul yin //
analyzed: ngag gi lam gyi spyod yul yin //
translated: the domain of the path of speech.

original: zhes pa ni sprul pa bzhin du chos bstan pa la brtson pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sprul pa bzhin du chos bstan pa la brtson pa'o //

original: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can kun la phan pa'i phyir //

analyzed: myur ba'i rnal 'byor bstan nas snang ba thob pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: tsita / sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

analyzed: sems ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Mind is the engaged consciousness.

analyzed: ma rig pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o //

original: de rnams kyi go rims bzhin du shes rab dang thabs nye bar thob pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi go rims bzhin du shes rab dang thabs nye bar thob pa ste /
translated: The attainment of wisdom and method in that order is

original: chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chen por 'gyur ro //

translated: Thus, by abiding in that way, the yogƒ´ of lesser capacity, having first experienced the clear light, subsequently sees the pristine consciousness of the attainment of the appearance that is like the appearance of the boundary.

analyzed: zhes pa la /

original: de la phyag rgya'i padmar bde ba chen po'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum rnam par dag par byed pa bde ba chen po'i rnam grangs can 'od gsal ba nyams su myong bas rol te /

translated: In that way, in the lotus of the consort, through the samƒÅdhi of great bliss, one experiences the clear light, which is the synonym of great bliss that purifies the three wisdoms of appearance, and so on, through the taste of the clear light.

analyzed: rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gnas so zhes nang gi don to //

analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum po mtshams la sogs pa'i sgras tha snyad du bya'o //

original: sna tshogs pa yi tha snyad ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa yi tha snyad ni //

analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi bya ba ste /

analyzed: spyod lam bzhi'i mtshan nyid can de dag chags pa dang bral ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dbye bas sna tshogs can te /

analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba'i bar ro //

original: 'jig rten pas ni yongs brtags pa //

analyzed: zhes tha tshig go //

original: 'dus byas pa'i mtshan nyid gsum ste /

original: de bzhin du yang srid pa bar ma na gang du bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang srid pa bar ma na gang du bstan to //

original: ji snyed 'jig rten gyis brtags pa //

analyzed: sems kyi rlung gi rnam 'phrul lo //

analyzed: sngags ni zhi ba dang khro ba dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i ngag gis brjod par gyur pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sems las byung ba rtse gcig pa la sogs pa'o //

original: nye bar sdud pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: ra / bdag byin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /

original: bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa spangs te /

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la mngon par zhen pa brgya la srid pas de dgag par bya ba'i phyir /

translated: In order to refute the hundred attachments to illusion-like meditative stabilization,üîΩthe BhagavƒÅn says:

original: rim pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes zur gyis mthar thug pa'i phyogs gcig pa 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir //üîΩmes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrim pa bzhi pas thob pa'i 'od gsal bas gal te bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i sku dag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rim pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba yin zhes zur gyis mthar thug pa'i phyogs gcig pa 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir // mes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rim pa bzhi pas thob pa'i 'od gsal bas gal te bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i sku dag par 'gyur na /
translated: In order to enter into the one-sided clear light of the ultimate, he says, One should meditate on the four stages.

original: @118a * // de'i tshe mes sbyangs pa'i gser bzhin du rnam par dag pa dri ma med cing spros pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir rim pa bzhin pa yang /

analyzed: sgom par byed par rig pa kho na'o // yang tshad ma nyid du bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

original: dpal ldan 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: dpal ldan 'dus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is a valid means of knowledge, he says, The glorious Guhyasamaja...

original: / rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis kho bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed la bzhugs pa'i tshig don ni gleng gzhi'i tshig don bshad pa yin zhes pa ni de ltar gtan la dbab par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje phreng ba zhes bya ba'i bshad pa'i rgyud las bcom ldan 'das 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyis kho bo'i rgyal po gshin rje gshed la bzhugs pa'i tshig don ni gleng gzhi'i tshig don bshad pa yin zhes pa ni de ltar gtan la dbab par bstan pa'o //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the ascertainment is shown.

original: sbas pa zhes pa ni bshad pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: sbas pa zhes pa ni bshad pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The word hidden is a special explanation.

original: de nas / don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nas / don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows:

original: 'dod chags kyi chos bstan pa'i sgo nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa dang ye shes gsum brtags pa'i sgo nas sems la rnam par rtog pa'i rim pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtog pa'i sgo nas bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bsten zhes sbas pas rim pa gsum so sor bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi chos bstan pa'i sgo nas rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa dang ye shes gsum brtags pa'i sgo nas sems la rnam par rtog pa'i rim pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa rtog pa'i sgo nas bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pa bsten zhes sbas pas rim pa gsum so sor bstan to //
translated: The three stages of the vajra repetition, by means of the teaching of the Dharma of passion, the stage of the conceptual thought in the mind, by means of the examination of the three intuitions, and the stage of self-consecration, by means of the examination of the relative truth, are taught by the word hidden, each of the three stages being taught separately.

original: yang lung gis bshad pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'dis rim pa tha ma gnyis po ston par byed pa mthar thug pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang lung gis bshad pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba 'dis rim pa tha ma gnyis po ston par byed pa mthar thug pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, the statement ‚Äúexplained by scripture‚Äù indicates the ultimate teaching of the two final stages.

original: rgyud 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rgyud 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach that, he says ‚Äúthis tantra,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes sdud pa po'i tshig gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes sdud pa po'i tshig gsal ba kho na'o //

original: gsal ba 'ga' zhig dus yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba 'ga' zhig dus yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúSome clear‚Äù is the time.

analyzed: zhes pa ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su bcom ldan 'das kyi khyad par ro //

analyzed: rdo rje gsang ba bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje ni rtags bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe BhagavƒÅn of the secret vajra‚Äù is the teaching of the sign of the secret vajra.

original: de'i dbang phyug ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis bde ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbang phyug ni snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis bde ba thob pa'o //

original: rdo rje gsum po dam tshig mchog //

analyzed: ces pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs zhes 'di bshad pa'o //

original: des na don 'di yin te /

original: rdo rje gsum ni sku la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni sku la sogs pa'o //
