original: ye shes de bzhin gshegs pa kun //
analyzed: ye shes de bzhin gshegs pa kun //
translated: The knowledge of all the Tathagatas

original: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum ni btsun mo'i bha ga'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rdo rje gsum ni btsun mo'i bha ga'i khyad par ro //
translated: is the special quality of the bhaga of the Lady, the three vajras.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun ni phung po lnga'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun ni phung po lnga'i ye shes te /
translated: The knowledge of the five aggregates of all the Tathagatas

original: ro gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa ni 'od @118b gsal ba'o //üîΩyon tan phun tshogs bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: ro gcig pa nyid du rtogs pa ni 'od @118b gsal ba'o // yon tan phun tshogs bsam mi khyab //
translated: is the realization of the one taste, which is clear light.üîΩThe inconceivable perfection of good qualities

original: ces pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang la yod pa de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: is that which has the inconceivable collection of qualities of the Buddha, such as the factors of enlightenment.

original: des ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo rtag tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can rim pa bzhi pa nges par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo rtag tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin can rim pa bzhi pa nges par bstan to //
translated: By that, the nature of the Dharma Body, which is always of the nature of the joy, the fourth stage, is taught.

original: chad par lta ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom par bya ba yin pas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chad par lta ba spang bar bya ba'i phyir mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings la mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid bsgom par bya ba yin pas de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the view of annihilation, one should cultivate the characteristic of the sphere of non-abiding nirvana.

original: yod med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: yod med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga spangs pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa gnyi ga bral ba ste zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga spangs pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa gnyi ga bral ba ste zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The existence and non-existence of both, and the freedom from both the possible and the impossible, is the concentration of union.

original: nam mkha' gcig pu'i ngo bo 'dir //
analyzed: nam mkha' gcig pu'i ngo bo 'dir //
translated: In this single essence of space,

original: zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings kyi ngo bor ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings kyi ngo bor ro //
translated: This is the essence of the sphere of unobstructed gnosis.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bsgom //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bsgom //
translated: One should cultivate the gnosis of omniscience,

original: zhes pa ni rtag tu 'char zhing dri ma med pa'i 'gro ba gsum po skad cig ma gcig gis yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rtag tu 'char zhing dri ma med pa'i 'gro ba gsum po skad cig ma gcig gis yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: Which is the instantaneous knowledge of the three worlds, which always arises and is stainless.

original: 'gro snying zhes pa ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid khams gsum gyi rgyu rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de kho na nyid ces 'od gsal ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'gro snying zhes pa ni g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i ngo bo nyid khams gsum gyi rgyu rdo rje 'chang chen po'i de kho na nyid ces 'od gsal ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: The ‚Äúessence of going‚Äù is the reality of the Great Vajradhara, the cause of the three worlds, the essence of the moving and unmoving, the special clear light.

original: rnam dag ces pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dag par byed pa zhes zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rnam dag ces pa ni bden pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma dag par byed pa zhes zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚Äú Pure‚Äù means the purifier of the stains of the concepts of the two truths, the special stage of union.

original: thub pa chen po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po bzhugs so zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs so //
analyzed: thub pa chen po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po bzhugs so zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs so //
translated: ‚Äú The Great Sage‚Äù is the Bhagavat Great Vajradhara, ‚Äúdwelling‚Äù in the concentration of the realm of non-abiding nirvana.

original: mthar thug pa zhes pa ni rim pa tha ma so sor ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mthar thug pa zhes pa ni rim pa tha ma so sor ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚Äú Ultimate‚Äù means the final stage, the one who teaches individually.

original: de las gzhan la mi slob pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: de las gzhan la mi slob pa'i phyir ro//
translated: Because there is no other stage beyond that, there is no more training.

original: slob ma la bshad pa'o zhes pa ni rim po che lta bu'i gang zag snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma la bshad pa'o zhes pa ni rim po che lta bu'i gang zag snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Explaining to the disciple‚Äù means the person who is a vessel like a great mountain.

original: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that has been explained previously.

original: bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: This is the summarized meaning.

original: yi ge'i don dang spyi'i don dag gis bskyed pa'i rim pa dang sbas pa dang mthar thug pa'i rim pa dag gis rim pa lnga zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge'i don dang spyi'i don dag gis bskyed pa'i rim pa dang sbas pa dang mthar thug pa'i rim pa dag gis rim pa lnga zhes bya ba rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: The five stages are taught by the creation stage, the hidden stage, and the ultimate stage, which are generated by the meaning of the words and the general meaning.

original: de bas na bzhugs pa'i tshig nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na bzhugs pa'i tshig nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said ‚Äúthe words of the abode‚Äù and so on.

original: bzhugs pa'i phyogs gcig dang ldan pa'i tshig ni bzhugs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i phyogs gcig dang ldan pa'i tshig ni bzhugs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words of the abode are the words that possess one part of the abode.

original: bar gyi sgra'i dbye bar byas pa'i las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bar gyi sgra'i dbye bar byas pa'i las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The action is taken as the division of the middle sound.

original: rgyud ma las pa'i dgongs pa /
analyzed: rgyud ma las pa'i dgongs pa /
translated: The intention of the tantra that is not explained.

original: zhes pa ni le'u bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi @119a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni le'u bco brgyad kyi bdag nyid kyi @119a * //
translated: This is the tantra with the nature of eighteen chapters.

original: rgyud kyi don rim pa gnyis ma gtogs par gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi don rim pa gnyis ma gtogs par gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Except for the two stages of the meaning of the tantra, nothing else is observed.

original: yod na yang de nyid du 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: yod na yang de nyid du 'dus pa'o //
translated: Even if it exists, it is included in just that.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the perfection of the retinue,

original: brjod kyis mi lang pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said ‚Äúinexpressible‚Äù and so on.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni nyan pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni nyan pa po phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The excellence of the retinue is the excellence of the listeners.

original: ston te zhes pa ni sdud pa pos zhes tshig lhag ma ste 'chad pa po dang gnas phun sum tshogs pa dag ni gleng gzhi'i tshig nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston te zhes pa ni sdud pa pos zhes tshig lhag ma ste 'chad pa po dang gnas phun sum tshogs pa dag ni gleng gzhi'i tshig nyid du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word teaches has an understood he, i.e., the compiler. The excellence of the teacher and the excellence of the place are indicated by the words of the nidana itself.

original: brjod kyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mang ba tsam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod kyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mang ba tsam du dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase inexpressible... and so on is intended to indicate the mere multitude of those who are to be converted.

original: yang brjod kyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la gzugs ni mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: yang brjod kyis mi lang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni de la gzugs ni mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: Again, the phrase inexpressible... and so on indicates that the form of those to be converted is inexhaustible.

original: yon tan ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The virtue is the characteristic of the perfections such as giving.

original: de yang ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ngag gi spyod yul las 'das pa'o //
translated: And that is beyond the range of speech.

original: de dag ces pha ni grangs dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ces pha ni grangs dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dpag tu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word their refers to the countless forms, qualities, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bstan to //
translated: The example is indicated by the words Buddha-field... and so on.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor pa smos te /
translated: The mandala is mentioned by by whom and so on.

original: de tsam rgyud 'di ru bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam rgyud 'di ru bsgom par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the statement just this much is to be cultivated in this tantra,

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag kho na gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas de dag kho na gsungs so //
translated: and just this much is to be cultivated in this tantra is stated by thus and so on.

original: dam tshig rdo rje ni don yod par grub pa zhes pa la /
analyzed: dam tshig rdo rje ni don yod par grub pa zhes pa la /
translated: The commitment vajra is Amoghasiddhi,

original: dam tshig gi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig gi rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is the commitment family.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩHatred, delusion, passion,

original: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang // yid bzhin nor bu dam tshig ni //
analyzed: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang // yid bzhin nor bu dam tshig ni //
translated: wish-fulfilling gem, and commitment

original: 'di dag rigs ni lnga po ste //üîΩ'dod dang thar pa rab bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag rigs ni lnga po ste // 'dod dang thar pa rab bsgrub pa'o //
translated: are the five families,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: which are to be accomplished for the sake of liberation and desire.

original: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rigs dang rigs can rnams la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rigs dang rigs can rnams la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, and so on refers to the families and those who possess the families, because there is no distinction between them.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sgra ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term bodhisattva is used because the enjoyment body and the emanation body are inseparable.

original: dbyer med pa yang bya ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med pa yang bya ba gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are inseparable because they have the same function.

original: de ltar sku rdo rje la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar sku rdo rje la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Thus, the Vajra Body, etc. are as before.

original: ting nge 'dzin rdo rje ni nam mkha' snying po zhes pa la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rdo rje ni nam mkha' snying po zhes pa la /
translated: The Vajra Concentration is Akashagarbha.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi rigs nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The family of Ratnasa·πÉbhava is the chief of the concentrations such as the sky treasure.

original: rgyal ba rdo rje ni byams pa zhes pa la //
analyzed: rgyal ba rdo rje ni byams pa zhes pa la //
translated: The Vajra Victor is Maitreya.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' mdzad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩsa rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa khams bzhi'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo spyan la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su chos kyi rgyal srid la mnga' mdzad pa'i phyir ro // sa rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa khams bzhi'i rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo spyan la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: He will rule the kingdom of Dharma in the future.üîΩThe four elements such as earth are taught as the essence of the purities, such as Locana, etc.

original: dam tshig sgrol ma zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'i @119b rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig sgrol ma zhes pa ni don yod grub pa'i @119b rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pledge Tara is Amoghasiddhi.

original: gang gi phyir sgrol ma ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrol ma ni gnyis te /
translated: Because Tara is twofold:

original: dam tshig gi sgrol ma dang / dbang gi sgrol ma'o //
analyzed: dam tshig gi sgrol ma dang / dbang gi sgrol ma'o //
translated: the pledge Tara and the power Tara.

original: dbang gi sgrol ma ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can no //
analyzed: dbang gi sgrol ma ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can no //
translated: The power Tara is of the family of Amitabha.

original: dam tshig sgrol ma ni de nyid kyi sku'i bye brag go //
analyzed: dam tshig sgrol ma ni de nyid kyi sku'i bye brag go //
translated: The pledge Tara is a particular body of him.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje ni 'jam dpal zhes pa la rtag tu dri ma med cing zag pa med pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje ni 'jam dpal zhes pa la rtag tu dri ma med cing zag pa med pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vajra of space is Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, because he is always endowed with stainless, uncontaminated wisdom.

original: gzugs rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can mchod pa'i lha mo dang dbus kyi gtso mo yang bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid can mchod pa'i lha mo dang dbus kyi gtso mo yang bstan to //
translated: With vajra of form, etc., he teaches the offering goddesses and the central goddess, whose characteristics are the purities of form, etc.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje kun tu bzang po zhes pa ni chos ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can 'dzin pa dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje kun tu bzang po zhes pa ni chos ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin can 'dzin pa dang / mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje ste /
translated: The vajra of the realm of phenomena, Samantabhadra, is the vajra of the realm of phenomena, whose nature is the wisdom of accomplishing activities, because it is indivisible and holds.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje dam tshig gi rigs can no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje dam tshig gi rigs can no //
translated: He is of the family of the commitment of the vajra of the realm of phenomena.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i dbyings dang mtshungs pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i dbyings dang mtshungs pa /
translated: With the assembly of bodhisattvas, etc., he teaches the retinue of the enjoyment body, which is equal to space.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: The tathƒÅgatas, whose nature is the enjoyment body, speak.

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga bzung ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa lnga bzung ste /
translated: The those and so forth refer to the five beginning with Vairochana,

original: de dang 'dra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kyang bstan to //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan rnams kyang bstan to //
translated: and also indicate other Tathagatas similar to them.

original: rigs lngas bsdus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams kho na bstan to //
analyzed: rigs lngas bsdus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de rnams kho na bstan to //
translated: The included in the five families and so forth indicate just those.

original: de ltar na gang gis lha'i 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs pa de tsam nyid kyi dpe bsten pa'i phyir de bas na sum cu rtsa gnyis dgod par rigs na ci'i phyir khro bo rnams ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis lha'i 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs pa de tsam nyid kyi dpe bsten pa'i phyir de bas na sum cu rtsa gnyis dgod par rigs na ci'i phyir khro bo rnams ma bstan zhe na /
translated: Thus, since the mandala of deities is complete just by that much, in order to teach the example, it is reasonable to set forth the thirty-two, so why are the wrathful ones not taught?

original: de ni bden te /üîΩ'on kyang 'grel pa mkhan gyis 'chad par 'gyur te /üîΩdper na sku'i dkyil 'khor nyid du lha dgod pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i rgyud kyi khungs las /
analyzed: de ni bden te / 'on kyang 'grel pa mkhan gyis 'chad par 'gyur te / dper na sku'i dkyil 'khor nyid du lha dgod pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i rgyud kyi khungs las /
translated: That is true.üîΩHowever, the commentator will explain, For example, just as the deities are set forth in the body mandala, and so forth, and so on.üîΩ In the source tantra explained by the words just as the deities are set forth in the body mandala,

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du 'byin pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang yod par rigs so //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du 'byin pa'i dkyil 'khor la yang yod par rigs so //
translated: it is reasonable that the emanation mandala also has them.

original: 'dir ma gsungs pa ni rang gis glegs bam lta ba rnams la 'khrul pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ma gsungs pa ni rang gis glegs bam lta ba rnams la 'khrul pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What is not mentioned here is for the sake of generating error in those who look at the books.

original: 'byin pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su le'u dang po las bzhi po gsungs te lhag ma rnams le'u bcu gsum po las gsungs pa rnams mdo bsres te shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi skabs su le'u dang po las bzhi po gsungs te lhag ma rnams le'u bcu gsum po las gsungs pa rnams mdo bsres te shes par bya'o //
translated: In the context of the emanation ma·πá·∏çala, the four chapters are mentioned, and the rest are mentioned in the thirteen chapters. They should be understood as mixed in the s≈´tra.

original: klog pa'i rim pa las don gyi rim pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: klog pa'i rim pa las don gyi rim pa stobs dang ldan pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The order of the meaning is more powerful than the order of recitation.

original: de'i phyir gang gis lha'i 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba gang gsungs pa de ni @120a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis lha'i 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba gang gsungs pa de ni @120a * //
translated: Therefore, whatever is said to be the complete circle of deities, that is

original: rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: only reasonable.

original: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal yas khang pa'i phyi rol tu bar snang la bzhugs so zhes pa'i bar du 'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad dang mnyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhal yas khang pa'i phyi rol tu bar snang la bzhugs so zhes pa'i bar du 'o //
translated: The statement beginning with equal to the realm of space and so on up to abiding in the space outside the celestial mansion is as follows.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas til gyi gang bu'i dpes de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yas pa rnams kyi gnas pa mi 'gal ba bstan pa'o //

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gleng gzhi sdud par byed do //
translated: Thus, etc.üîΩThe one who is the abode of the desire realm, etc.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa'i yul la chags pa'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la bstan pa'i dus su dang po rang gi sku la grub pa'i lha'i 'khor lo phyi rol du spros te /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa'i yul la chags pa'i sems can rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa la dpal gsang ba 'dus pa la bstan pa'i dus su dang po rang gi sku la grub pa'i lha'i 'khor lo phyi rol du spros te /
translated: At the time of the teaching of the glorious Guhyasamaja, first emanate the circle of deities accomplished in one's body outside.

original: slar yang sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bsdus la /
analyzed: slar yang sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul du bsdus la /
translated: Again, gather them in the form of the body mandala.

original: slar yang lha mo dgur spros te /
analyzed: slar yang lha mo dgur spros te /
translated: Again, emanate them as the nine goddesses.

original: de dag gcig tu song ba dang lhan cig tu bde ba chen po myong nas slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nye bar bsdus te gzhal yas khang pa sprul zhing de'i nad du lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlabs la /
analyzed: de dag gcig tu song ba dang lhan cig tu bde ba chen po myong nas slar yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad nye bar bsdus te gzhal yas khang pa sprul zhing de'i nad du lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlabs la /
translated: Having experienced great bliss by their going together, again gather all the Tathagatas and emanate the celestial mansion. In its center, bless the mandala of imagination.

original: de yang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas nye bar bsdus te dbus kyi gtso bor gyur nas dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar dkyil 'khor 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin rab tu bstan par gyur
analyzed: de yang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas nye bar bsdus te dbus kyi gtso bor gyur nas dang po'i sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar dkyil 'khor 'byin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin rab tu bstan par gyur
translated: Moreover, having been gathered into the center of the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala, having become the principal one in the center, the samƒÅdhi of the supreme victor ma·πá·∏çala, which has the characteristic of emanating the ma·πá·∏çala at the end of the samƒÅdhi of the first union, is fully explained.

original: to // de nyid spros te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: to // de nyid spros te bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that in detail,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa la /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúthe qualities of desire,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa la phyag rgya gcig la gnas pas grol bar rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la phyag rgya gcig la gnas pas grol bar rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach liberation through abiding in the single mudra of form and so on,üîΩ‚Äúthen‚Äù means immediately after,

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o zhes pa ni 'khor gyi nang du gnas @120b pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'o zhes pa ni 'khor gyi nang du gnas @120b pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: and ‚Äúin the midst of the retinue‚Äù means below.

original: yon tan brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang ldan pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: yon tan brgyad kyi dbang phyug dang ldan pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The one endowed with the eight qualities has been explained previously.

original: chen po yang yin la rnam par snang mdzad kyang yin pas na zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chen po yang yin la rnam par snang mdzad kyang yin pas na zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is great and also Vairocana, thus he is called Great Vajradhara.

original: 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags rab tu spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni phyag rgya bstan pa'i chags pas 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis 'dod chags rab tu spang bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni phyag rgya bstan pa'i chags pas 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa bzlog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to abandon desire by means of desire, in order to overcome the affliction of desire by means of the desire of displaying the seal.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sku spangs nas zhes pa ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus su sgeg pa'i nyams gcor  gyur pas sgeg cing gzugs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sku spangs nas zhes pa ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus su sgeg pa'i nyams gcor  gyur pas sgeg cing gzugs bstan to //
translated: Having abandoned the body of passionlessness, having abandoned the body of the ascetic, in the age of the five degenerations, he displays his body with the appearance of a libertine.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúGreat Vajradhara.‚Äù

original: sems can rnams smin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu can yin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sems can rnams smin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu can yin zhes bstan to //
translated: By ‚Äúin order to ripen sentient beings,‚Äù and so on, he teaches that the nature of the tathƒÅgatas is caused by the essence of great compassion.

original: de bas na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pas gang gi tshe 'gro ba'i don byed na de'i tshe de rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dpal rdo rje 'chang chen pos dmigs par mdzad ces rgyud thams cad kyi gzhung
analyzed: de bas na dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bsgom pas gang gi tshe 'gro ba'i don byed na de'i tshe de rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dpal rdo rje 'chang chen pos dmigs par mdzad ces rgyud thams cad kyi gzhung
translated: Therefore, when one accomplishes the aims of beings by means of the meditation on the wheel of the ma·πá·∏çala, then, in order to complete that, the glorious Great Vajradhara focuses on the samƒÅdhi that is consistent with that.üîΩThis is the system of all the tantras.

original: lugs so // dkyil 'khor ba rnams zhes pa ni 'khor rnams so //üîΩrang gi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka na gnas pa padma dang zla ba dang rdo rje la gnas pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyi lcags kyus nam mkha'i dbyings na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs
analyzed: lugs so // dkyil 'khor ba rnams zhes pa ni 'khor rnams so // rang gi sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka na gnas pa padma dang zla ba dang rdo rje la gnas pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyi lcags kyus nam mkha'i dbyings na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs
translated: The ma·πá·∏çala retinue is the retinue.

original: pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bkug la 'jug par mdzad do //
analyzed: pa la sogs pa'i tshogs bkug la 'jug par mdzad do //
translated: With ‚Äúone‚Äôs seed,‚Äù and so on, the hook of light rays from the seed syllable of Great Vajradhara, abiding on the lotus, moon, and vajra in the heart of the gnosis being, summons the assembly of tathƒÅgatas, and so on, abiding in the realm of space and causes them to enter.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sngar nye bar bsdus pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bud med mchog gi gzugs su bcom ldan 'das kyi spros pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sngar nye bar bsdus pa gang yin pa de rnams kyis dga' ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir bud med mchog gi gzugs su bcom ldan 'das kyi spros pa mdzad do //
translated: Then, with ‚ÄúThen all the TathƒÅgatas,‚Äù etc., in order to generate delight in those who were previously gathered, the Blessed One emanated in the form of the supreme woman.

original: de ni don dam par bud med dang skyes pa'i bye brag gang yang med do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ni don dam par bud med dang skyes pa'i bye brag gang yang med do zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that ultimately there is no distinction of woman or man.

original: gdul bya rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rol ston gyi spros pa rmad du byung bar bstan to //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams 'jug par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi rol ston gyi spros pa rmad du byung bar bstan to //
translated: In order to engage those to be tamed, the Buddha‚Äôs display is taught to be marvelous.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das mchog tu dga' ba'i bde bas /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das mchog tu dga' ba'i bde bas /
translated: There, the Blessed One, with the bliss of supreme joy,

original: zhes pa ni mchog tu dga' ba las phyi ma'i dga' ba ni mchog tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mchog tu dga' ba las phyi ma'i dga' ba ni mchog tu dga' ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúsupreme joy‚Äù is the joy after supreme joy.

original: 'od gsal ba bzhi pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba bzhi pa la 'jug go //
translated: It is the entry into the fourth illumination.

original: yang na mchog ni thams cad kyi phul du byung ba ste dga' ba bzhi pa kho na'o //
analyzed: yang na mchog ni thams cad kyi phul du byung ba ste dga' ba bzhi pa kho na'o //
translated: Alternatively, ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù is the best of all, which is the fourth joy alone.

original: rnal 'byor pa la grags pa'i @121a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la grags pa'i @121a * //
translated: It is the supreme joy of the yogin.

original: rigs pas mchog tu dga' ba'i sgras kyang bzhi pa brjod do //
analyzed: rigs pas mchog tu dga' ba'i sgras kyang bzhi pa brjod do //
translated: The fourth is also expressed by the word supreme joy, because it is the supreme of joys.

original: de lta na rang gzugs su de nyid ci'i phyir ma gzung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na rang gzugs su de nyid ci'i phyir ma gzung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not grasped as such in its own form?

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is momentary.

original: bzhi pa ni blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The fourth is to be taken up,

original: rtog pa med pa nyid kyis rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid kyis rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent, being without conceptualization.

original: de bas na stim par bya ba'i phyir zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: de bas na stim par bya ba'i phyir zhes smos pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is to be taken up in order to be satisfied.

original: de nyid kyis tshim par bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis tshim par bya bar rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that it is to be satisfied by that,

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is without error.

original: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi bde ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi bde ba ni 'khrul pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The bliss of the three wisdoms of appearance and so on is accompanied by error,

original: de ma yin pa la de nyid du gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa la de nyid du gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it apprehends what is not that as that.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa la ni 'khrul pa med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa la ni 'khrul pa med de /
translated: But there is no error in natural purity,

original: chos nyid ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos nyid ni 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because reality is without error.

original: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lha mo dgu ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: gnas skabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ba'i lha mo dgu ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams kyi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes rab tu bstan to //
translated: The occasion and so on indicate that the nine goddesses who will be explained below are the very nature of all the Tathagatas, goddesses, Bodhisattvas, and wrathful deities.

original: gzhi dang gzhi can thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi sems las 'byung ba yin pas de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi dang gzhi can thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor nye bar bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi sems las 'byung ba yin pas de'i rgyu mthun par gyur pa bde ba chen po'i ngo bo nyid gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Since the mandala of all the bases and the based-upon are included in the arising from the mind of enlightenment, it is the cause of that, and it is the manifestation of the nature of great bliss.

original: sa'i khams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs kyi btsun mo bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rigs kyi btsun mo bzhi bstan to //
translated: The earth element and so on indicate the four goddesses of the clans.

original: yang rnam par snang mdzad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs las 'byung ba'i lha mo lnga bstan to //
analyzed: yang rnam par snang mdzad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs las 'byung ba'i lha mo lnga bstan to //
translated: Again, Vairochana and so on indicate the five goddesses arising from the clans of Vairochana and so on.

original: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba tsam brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes pa ni spro ba dang bsdu ba tsam brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The interpretable meaning is because it is stated merely for the purpose of expansion and contraction.

original: des ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nye bar bsdus pas lha mo dgur spros te /
analyzed: des ni bcom ldan 'das nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad du bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams nye bar bsdus pas lha mo dgur spros te /
translated: By that, the BhagavƒÅn, having gathered the tathƒÅgatas residing in all the realms of space, emanates them as the nine goddesses.

original: de'i dbus su 'dod pa sna tshogs kyi dbang phyug nyid du bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i dbus su 'dod pa sna tshogs kyi dbang phyug nyid du bzhugs so //
translated: In their midst, he resides as the lord of various desires.

original: de'i 'og tu 'di ltar bya ba nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'di ltar bya ba nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: After that, this is what should be done:

original: 'dod chags kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod chags chen po'i chos zhes nang du song ba'i dngos po'i rkyen nyid kyis 'dod chags chen po'i chos nyid kyis brjod par bya ba ni 'od gsal ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang yin la chen po yang yin pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dod chags chen po'i chos zhes nang du song ba'i dngos po'i rkyen nyid kyis 'dod chags chen po'i chos nyid kyis brjod par bya ba ni 'od gsal ba nyid bstan to //
translated: Since it is desire and it is great, it is called ‚Äúgreat desire.‚Äù The nature of great desire is taught by the condition of the internalized entity, ‚Äúthe dharma of great desire.‚Äù

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba mched pa la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rnam grangs yin zhes bya @121b ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'dod chags bral ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snang ba mched pa la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum gyi rnam grangs yin zhes bya @121b ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äúdesire and freedom from desire‚Äù and so on are synonyms of the three exalted wisdoms of appearance, increase, and so on.

original: rnam par dag pa ni mngon du bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni mngon du bya ba ste /
translated: Purification is the realization,

original: 'od gsal ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba thob pa'o //
translated: the attainment of clear light.

original: thabs ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: thabs ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid kyis ni sems rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The method is the purification of the mind by the process of mantra and seal.

original: phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'o //üîΩphyi rol gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor de dag tu dmigs pa'i mngon par zhen pa spangs nas zhes pa ni bdag ni 'di yin pa dang 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa yin zhes de dag gis ni sems rnam par dag pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i
analyzed: phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rim pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'o // phyi rol gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor de dag tu dmigs pa'i mngon par zhen pa spangs nas zhes pa ni bdag ni 'di yin pa dang 'di rnams de bzhin gshegs pa yin zhes de dag gis ni sems rnam par dag pa dang mngon par byang chub pa'i
translated: The process characterized by the process of seal and samadhi is the manifest enlightenment.üîΩHaving abandoned the objective clinging to those retinues of Tathagatas outside,

original: rim pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim pa dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the non-existence of the purification of the mind and the process of manifest enlightenment in those,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su bsgrubs pa'i sku ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gnyis pa'i rim pa las myur du lha'i gzugs bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pas spro ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su bsgrubs pa'i sku ni bdag yin no zhes bya ba 'dis gnyis pa'i rim pa las myur du lha'i gzugs bdag byin gyis rlob pa'i rim pas spro ba'am /
translated: one should quickly generate the divine body by the process of self-consecration, with the thought The body which is accomplished by all the Tathagatas is myself.

original: yang na bzhi pa las zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje lta bu'i sku byin gyis brlab par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang na bzhi pa las zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rdo rje lta bu'i sku byin gyis brlab par mdzad do //
translated: Or else, by the stage of union in the fourth [consecration], he consecrates the vajra-like body.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas lung gi tshad ma nyid bshad do //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas lung gi tshad ma nyid bshad do //
translated: By himself and so on, he explains the validity of the scriptures.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni spro ba tsam gyi dpe yin gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba ni spro ba tsam gyi dpe yin gyi thams cad kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: By as before he means that the example is only of the emanation, not of everything.

original: gang gi phyir sngon du ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyis spros pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngon du ni rtog pa'i rnal 'byor gyis spros pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because previously, by the yoga of imagination, he emanated.

original: 'di ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'di ni sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis so //
translated: This is because of the illusion-like nature.

original: nges pa'i don zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag byin gyis rlob pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa rnams 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag byin gyis rlob pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa rnams 'chad par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By definitive meaning he means that he wishes to explain the mind-purification, the self-consecration, the manifest enlightenment, and the union.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod pa'i dbang phyug nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir lha mo dgu'i bdag nyid gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dod pa'i dbang phyug nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir lha mo dgu'i bdag nyid gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bstan to //
translated: By thus and so on, he teaches the retention mandala, which has the nature of the nine goddesses, in order to teach the sovereignty of desire.

original: sems gtso bo ni ngag dang lus kyi nang nas sems kho na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems gtso bo ni ngag dang lus kyi nang nas sems kho na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is the chief, because among speech and body, the mind alone is the chief.

original: mi bskyod pa'i bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i bya ba zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la rjes su zhugs pas bskyed pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje'i gzhi dang / gzhi can gyi mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprul pa mdzad ces tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i bsdus pa'i dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i bya ba zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po la rjes su zhugs pas bskyed pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje'i gzhi dang / gzhi can gyi mtshan nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprul pa mdzad ces tha tshig go //
translated: The emanation of the mandala included in Ak·π£obhya is the activity of emanation.  The meaning is that by entering into MahƒÅvajradhara, he emanates the mandala characterized by the basis of the mind vajra and the basis of the mind vajra.

original: snga ma bzhin te shes rab kyi gnas //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin te shes rab kyi gnas //
translated: As before, the abode of wisdom.

original: zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i rjes su h'um las byung ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya la'o //üîΩder chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyis gzhi dang ri rab la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yon @122a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid bsgom pa'i rjes su h'um las byung ba'i chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya la'o // der chud pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyis gzhi dang ri rab la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i gru bzhi pa la sogs pa'i yon @122a * //
translated: After the expulsion of obstructors and the meditation on emptiness, on the seal of the source of phenomena arisen from h≈´·πÉ.

original: tan dang ldan pa'i gzhi'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: tan dang ldan pa'i gzhi'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: Having entered there, etc.  The meaning is that the basis of wisdom and Meru, etc., are transformed, and the basis mandala endowed with the qualities of having four sides, etc., is generated.

original: dam tshig chen po zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: dam tshig chen po zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o //
translated: The ‚Äúgreat pledge‚Äù is the five Tathagatas.

original: de gang du 'dus pa de dam tshig chen po ste rdo rje 'chang chen po kho na'o //
analyzed: de gang du 'dus pa de dam tshig chen po ste rdo rje 'chang chen po kho na'o //
translated: Where they are assembled is the ‚Äúgreat pledge,‚Äù which is none other than Great Vajradhara.

original: dri ma thams cad dang bral ba las zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri mas ma gos pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma thams cad dang bral ba las zhes pa ni 'dod chags kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri mas ma gos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the state free from all stains‚Äù means that he is not sullied by the stain of the passion of desire.

original: sprul par mdzod ces pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas sprul to zhes tha tshig go //üîΩgzhal yas khang pa'i phyi rol na //
analyzed: sprul par mdzod ces pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pas sprul to zhes tha tshig go // gzhal yas khang pa'i phyi rol na //
translated: ‚ÄúManifestation‚Äù means that he is manifested by the creation stage.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu dang ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas shin tu dang ba nyid bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúOutside the celestial mansion‚Äù and so forth teaches the clarity.

original: aindra n'i la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin po che'i kha dog lnga bstan to //
analyzed: aindra n'i la zhes bya ba la sogs pas rin po che'i kha dog lnga bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúIndranƒ´la‚Äù and so forth teaches the five colors of the jewels.

original: byung ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i nang du sna tshogs padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dag tu myur du bsgoms pa'i lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor los nye bar mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i nang du sna tshogs padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dag tu myur du bsgoms pa'i lha sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor los nye bar mdzes pa'o //
translated: The mandala of the arisen and so forth refers to the mandala circle of the thirty-two deities that are quickly visualized inside of that as a variegated lotus, moon, and sun mandala circle, and it is beautified by the mandala circle.

original: 'dis ni gzhal yas khang pa bsgom pa'i 'og tu lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //üîΩphyogs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhal yas khang pa bsgom pa'i 'og tu lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to // phyogs bcu zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas brtsams te /
translated: This teaches the mandala of imagination after the visualization of the celestial mansion.

original: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i don to zhes bya ba'i bar du ni lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor nyid kyi khyad par ro //
translated: Beginning with the ten directions and so forth up to mandala means the special nature of the mandala of imagination.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dbus kyi gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen pos byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag po dbus kyi gtso bo rdo rje 'chang chen pos byin gyis brlab pa bstan to //
translated: The great Vajradhara and so forth teaches the consecration by the lord of the mandala of imagination, the principal one in the center, the great Vajradhara.

original: rigs lngas bsdus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor de nyid rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas sku'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: rigs lngas bsdus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor de nyid rdo rje phreng ba'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i rim pas sku'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
translated: The mandala of the five clans and so on is the very mandala of the imagination, and the ultimate mandala, which has the characteristic of entering the body mandala, is taught by the stages taught in the Vajravali Tantra.

original: drang ba'i don zhes bya ba ni dang po sbyor ba'i ting 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drang ba'i don zhes bya ba ni dang po sbyor ba'i ting 'dzin gyi phyogs gcig bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The interpretable meaning is because of teaching one part of the samadhi of the first application.

original: tshig gi don yang 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshig gi don yang 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows.

original: le'u bco brgyad pa las gsungs pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor sprul te /üîΩ'dod pa'i dbang phyug nyid du gyur pa bstan nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po spro ba sngon du 'gro bas khro bo'i 'khor los bgegs bskrad la le'u gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa stong pa nyid
analyzed: le'u bco brgyad pa las gsungs pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor sprul te / 'dod pa'i dbang phyug nyid du gyur pa bstan nas gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po spro ba sngon du 'gro bas khro bo'i 'khor los bgegs bskrad la le'u gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i dngos po med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa stong pa nyid
translated: Having emanated the dharani mandala taught in the eighteenth chapter andüîΩhaving taught the state of being the lord of desire, one should emanate the king of Sumbha, and having made that the preliminary, one should drive away the obstructors with the wrathful wheel, and one should actualize the emptiness

original: mngon du byas la /
analyzed: mngon du byas la /
translated: of the verse beginning with non-entity taught in the second chapter.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi yongs @122b su gyur pa'i ye shes kyis gzhir byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhi yongs @122b su gyur pa'i ye shes kyis gzhir byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The four ma·πá·∏çalas of wind and so on are completely transformed by the gnosis, which is the consecration of the ground.

original: ri rab yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i gzhal yas khang pa bsams la /
analyzed: ri rab yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i gzhal yas khang pa bsams la /
translated: The celestial mansion arises from the complete transformation of Mount Meru.

original: de'i nang du sna tshogs padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i steng du myur du dkyil 'khor pa'i tshogs bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i nang du sna tshogs padma dang zla ba dang nyi ma'i steng du myur du dkyil 'khor pa'i tshogs bskyed de /
translated: In its interior, on a multicolored lotus, moon, and sun, one should quickly generate the assembly of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: de nyid slar yang rang gi lus la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor du rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: de nyid slar yang rang gi lus la 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor du rnam par bsams te /
translated: That very [assembly] should be imagined as the ultimate ma·πá·∏çala, which has the characteristic of entering one‚Äôs own body.

original: bdag po de yang dbang po gnyis kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las 'byung ba'i 'dod chags kyi sems zhu bar gyur par bsams te /
analyzed: bdag po de yang dbang po gnyis kyis snyoms par zhugs pa las 'byung ba'i 'dod chags kyi sems zhu bar gyur par bsams te /
translated: That lord also, through the mind of passion that arises from the union of the two organs, should be imagined as the melting of bodhicitta.

original: stong pa nyid kyi sngags kyis brtan par bya zhing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sngags kyis brtan par bya zhing gnas par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize and remain with the mantra of emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ces pa nas brtsams te skye gnas yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid ces pa nas brtsams te skye gnas yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: From ‚Äúthe nature of consciousness‚Äù up to ‚Äúthe place of birth‚Äù teaches the completion stage.

original: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa gnyis pas 'od gsal ba thob pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa gnyis pas 'od gsal ba thob pa bstan to //
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom is the attainment of the clear light by the second stage of the mind's purification.

original: dgongs pa lung bstan zhes bya bas lung gi tshig tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dgongs pa lung bstan zhes bya bas lung gi tshig tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: The Sutra shows the validity of the words of the scripture.

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi gang bstan pa'i //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi gang bstan pa'i //
translated: The Teaching of all the Buddhas is the teaching of the clear light.

original: zhes pa ni de nyid la brten te //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de nyid la brten te //
translated: The Instruction is the instruction in the clear light.
